APD collaborates with NIMHANS & other professional bodies in this field to ensures psychotherapy and psychiatric treatment
The Association of People with Disability

title: Empower Children/Women/Disabled in Chennai Slums
description: Children, Women and Disabled in urban slums are even more vulnerable in comparing the rural population. This project will enable children, women and differently abled to get comprehensive care . Children will be able to complete more than high school and also women and differently abled will be able to learn at least one life skill that will help them to be self dependent. In long run the anti social population that is very common among young adults living in slums will significantly come down.

title: Send school 500 Sri Lankan Tamil refugees children
description: The project provides two sets uniforms, note books, writing materials with a school bag to 500 Sri Lankan Tamil refugees poor children in Tirunelveli District  in Tamilnadu, India

title: support-poor-needy-handicapped-orphans-indian
description:
TO MAKE AVAILABLE THE RESIDENTIAL FACILITIES, BOARDING ARRANGEMENTS, CLOTHING & MEDICAL AID TO THE PHYSICALLY HANDICAPPED, POOR NEED & HELPLESS ORPHANS STUDENTS
(MALE & FEMALE ) AT FREE OF CHARGE".

title: Job skills for poor and unemployed in India
description:
This project will bring a highly skilled English faculty member to coach our English and job skills trainers at Anudip's rural skill building centers. 

The faculty member will also provide personal coaching to staff of our IT project centers, all of whom come from below poverty line families, to enhance their ability to interact with US and European clients.

title: Help US Interns in INDIA Treat 1000 Villagers
description: Dr. Interns will send medical interns to host 2 mobile medical camps to treat over 1000 inhabitants of 3 villages in India where healthcare is inaccessible.

title: Livelihood opportunity to 50 women in kolkata slum
description: Development Action society (DAS) works in and around the dumping grounds (DHAPA) of Kolkata. Where the women's are mostly rag pickers and do not have any other source of Income. DAS is trying to set up various Income generation programme for these socially excluded population and create an alternative source of income. Through this their basic life standards will increase and they will be able to afford education for their child, nutritious food and also other basic needs

title: Confidence Building Camp for Orphan Children
description: Buds N Colors camp is for adolescent children orphaned in Tamilnadu. The aim of this camp is to share love, build hope and strengthen faith to live life with dignity and courage. Adolescents orphaned find it hard to set higher goals due to the fear that dominates their emotions. Losing father or mother has affected their self -image causing a severe low self esteem. Camp aims to build confidence and emerge as peer leaders for change.

title: Reaching the Disabled Through Mobile Clinics
description: Many disabled people cannot access our center due to lack of mobility, accessibility, inability to be carried and costly transport options. We will reach them through a mobile clinic.

title: Securing Tiger and Elephant Habitat in India
description: In the last 100 years, tiger populations have plummeted 97% to only 3,200 individuals due to habitat destruction and overhunting. Once found in 30 countries across Asia, today tigers are found only in scattered fragments across 12 countries, in less than 7% of their historical range. With the endangered Asian elephant sharing the same shrinking habitat, protecting India's remaining wild places is essential to the future of these two iconic species.

title: Help 100 disabled and street children in India
description: "Vidyaranya" has been executing "Spruthi" Residential School for Mentally Challenged children. 75 Mentally Challenged children are in the school. This institution is staffed with 7 trained teachers and 5 helpers. Vidyaranya is also executing "Open Shelter Programme" for street children in Bangalore, India with 25 kids benefits with Mid day meal Scheme, medical care and education. Sponsor these children to get access to shelter, food, clothing, medical care and recreational facilities.

title: renovationhousing-to-100-tribals-in-india
description: This project is helping Renovation  of housing for 100 Tribalas in india   living  in slum areas and side of Road sides. They have  own Registered  land  but  no proper houses  .Mostly living under difficult circumstances  , At present their  houses which are  Hut or semi concrete buildings i.e. foundation and walls with bricks and cement and roof with coconut leaves . Because their building is  totally collapsed , roof  , flooring and   walls were damaged.

title: Help entrepreneurs in India start businesses.
description: This project will provide 1,100 disadvantaged youth with comprehensive skills training and support to become successful entrepreneurs.  Among other activities, the project will offer participants business and life skills training, access to financial capital through a revolving loan fund, ongoing technical assistance and links to mentors in the business community.

title: Give trafficked girls a new future in India
description: The Dream Home provides girls ages 13-18, rescued from sex trafficking a safe, loving place to live and the aftercare restoration necessary to realize a hopeful new future, one built on her dreams. Each girl receives personalized care to heal from her past and provide opportunities for her future. A girl who finds her home here finds a new beginning. She finds hope, with holistic trauma therapy, medical care, life skills training and sustainable career skills, she finds a dream for her future

title: Educate 540 children in rural Tamil Nadu
description: Educating tomorrow's generation today - many children in rural Tamil Nadu drop out of school for various reasons. With your help we will be able to reach out to children - under achievers within the age group of 5 to 15 by providing them free supplemental learning - enriching their knowledge in local language (Tamil), English, and Maths The project will cover 3 villages, with a children's library, and 3 learning centers each, reaching a total of 540 children in rural Tamil Nadu.

title: Support 40 Orphans&600 Needy Children of Sundarban
description: A care home for destitute and deprived homeless children of deserted Sundarban Coastal Area, we are trying to provide them with quality education, proper nutrition and care in a homely environment to gift them with a better tomorrow. Moreover we are helping 600 backward class Children to have pre-primary education through our 10 nos creche (free of cost) with uniform, books nutrition supplements in different blocks of S 24 Pgs. adjacent to Coastal Sundarban.

title: Helpline for Women: Project Specific Corpus Fund
description: The project assists at least 600 women in distress through 24 hour telephone rescue services, and provides them shelter, medical aid, repatriation, legal and other long term support.

title: Empower 2,000 women in the Rural Himalayas
description: This project integrates rural technology that is easy to construct, socially acceptable, economically viable and environmentally friendly to strengthen rural livelihoods and reduce women’s drudgery.

title: Give a child in India a future as a music teacher!
description: The My Peace Music Institute (MPMI) provides children from underpriviledged families with a free training to become music teachers. It offers a setting to learn, play, socialize, expand and relax as well. It is located in Kalimpong near Darjeeling, West Bengal.

title: Help 40 School Dropouts Generate Family Income
description: 40 School Dropouts will be trained in vocational courses. Infrastructure development is a major share of project cost. Returns would accrue greater disposable income to rural youth and their families.

title: "Rahat Floods"- Support flood victims in India!
description: In the June of 2013, the northern states of Uttarakhand & Himachal Pradesh were hit with the worst floods in recent memory. The loss of life and property is unprecedented. Owing to the treacherous terrain, rescue and relief operations are intermittent. People are faced with the dearth of basic necessities such as water, food, shelter, clothing, medicines etc. This project will work for the relief and rehabilitation of the flood victims.

title: Help us save lives in Uttarakhand!
description: Thousands of stranded pilgrims and uprooted families urgently need support. Over 14,000 pilgrims are still missing, 60,000 stranded and close to 200 people are reported to be dead from the unprecedented rains followed by floods and landslides. This is an urgent appeal to help and support distressed people in Uttarakhand.

title: Emergency Response to Floods in Northern India
description: Severe monsoon rains have created devastating floods and landslides throughout Northern India; 180 villages have been hit by the floods and more than 50,000 people have been forced to leave their homes. Thousands of families are in immediate need for food, shelter, blankets and other basic household items.

title: Enhancing employability through computer literacy
description: The core objective of the computer literacy programme supported by Concern India Foundation is to provide youth with the opportunity to become more familiar with computer usage, to use technology to further enhancing their capabilities, to support them in their academic requirements and equip them with skills that will enhance their employability.

title: Support the Uttarakhand India flooding victims
description: AmeriCares is responding to the disaster by deploying medical teams to treat patients in areas cut off from services. Working with the local government and health care officials, we are providing water purification tablets, antibiotics and analgesics, as well as medications for chronic diseases such as diabetes for people who don't have access to medicine or medical care.We are establishing a three to six-month intervention with focus on providing primary and maternal and child care.

title: Helping 50 Mentally and Physically Challenged
description: We have a Project for the Mentally and Physically Challenged Children. We are running an Special School for 40 Children and also a Home based Rehabilitation for 10 Severely Challenged Children. You can visit www.ashakiranashram.com. Now we need funding for the Running Expenditure and also for the construction of the Compound Wall and Security Guard's Room.
CELESTIAL MINISTRIES CHARITABLE AND EDUCATIONAL TRUST

title: Educate 100 marginalised children in Kadapa
description: Eradication of Child Labor through  Modern education to 100 Child Labor in the rural areas of Badvel, Mydukur constitutions (around 400000 Population) in Kadapa District.

title: Rehabilitation of People with Disability
description: As per conservative figures there are 1million disabled people in Karnataka. APD intends to use advanced  Information & Communication Technology (ICT) to address the education, health care and all rehabilitation issues of people with disability in the state of Karnataka. APD addresses this through Remote & connected Classrooms using advanced ICT. This will impact 7000 PWD's in Year1.By Year 5 the impact will be on 0.2million people.
The Association of People with Disability

title: Solar Power
description: To harness the solar energy so that the intellectually kids can get a better living, nutritious food, electricity to survive and most importantly life..

title: Sustain education of 350 under privileged children
description: Till date we have helped 350 under privileged children. They come from very challenging circumstances where their financial constraints are a hindrance to their education. Dropout rate is very high as there is a need to contribute to the family income. To sustain their education we provide free tuition, books, stationery, refreshment, mentoring, counseling, home visits and medical help. The focus of this project is to ensure continuity in their education and make them self reliant.
Nai Disha Educational And Cultural Society

title: Health & hygiene support for 500 girls in india
description: This project will improve the health & hygiene of 500 less fortunate adolescent girls in Amritsar district of Punjab in India. Health services and medical check-ups will be provided for a period of three months.

title: HOSTEL & SCHOOL FOR BLIND GIRLS & CHILDRENS
description:
INDIAN MULTI PURPOSE TRUST FOR THE BLIND  IS THE FIRST NGO IN INDIA. WHO WORKS FOR THE BLIND FAMILIES SINCE LAST 13 YEARS.we give special attention and care to the blind persons after their marriage and when they are in the process of settling down as a family. 
The real problem starts when they marry a similar partner, have kids and try to settle in some remote rural area because of financial constraint as no organization of hostel houses such families.
indian multi purpose trust for the blind

title: Donate solar lamps to tribal girls to battle dark
description: The children in tribal's area find very difficult to cop up with the dark atmosphere and it is worse during winter and rainy season. They have small huts where the whole family has to Jung inn. It becomes a tough and horrible situation that students could not concentrate on their studies. Due to lack of sufficient space and unpleasant situation in and abounds.

title: 1000 small farmer families come out of distress
description: Working with 1000 resource poor farming families to convert their farmland into sustainable, risk proof, Integrated Farming System (IFS) with substantially improved bio diversity, leading to better livelihood and environment
Society for Community Participation and Empowerment

title: Education to 410 poor children from 30 villages
description: Project area is Socio-economically back ward. Major population is marginalized communities & marginal famers. Agriculture is the only means of livelihood. JRDS is presently runs Nursery to 7th grade & boarding to orphan & poor children and plans to upgrade to 10th grade. School building needs repair additional class rooms, library, labs & sports equipment to provide quality and competitive education to 410 poor children from 30 villages and school compound since it is vulnerable to wild animals.

title: Provide food shelter clothing & Edu for in India
description: Round Table our society plans to provide free education ,food,shelter & clothing for children with mentally handicapped who hail from Shri Sant Gadgebaba Shikshan Sanstha, also providing education, food, shelter & clothing.
Shree Sant Gadgebaba Shikshan Sanstha pachora Dist Jalgon

title: Books for Health Education: India & South Asia
description: This project sends free copies of Where There Is No Doctor and other Hesperian popular education materials to health workers and community leaders working to improve health in poor communities.

title: $1 Science and Art lessons for 1800 kids in India
description: This project fills the gap of participatory and interactive opportunities for economically disadvantaged kids in rural India by providing free hands-on science and art lessons using low-cost materials. The lessons are delivered through an innovative channel, namely the Science on Wheels and Art on Wheels programs. These moving labs, filled with science experiments and low-cost art supplies, go to village schools and carry out interactive demonstrations and hands-on activities for the children.

title: 3420 children with life threatening illness, India
description: Fulfilling a wish enriches the human experience with hope, strength and joy. This appeal is to seek your support to adopt a wish or donate any amount that you wish to help us fulfill the wish of a child with a life-threatening medical condition in India.

title: Financial & Social Literacy for 20000 Indian kids
description:
The project will help 20000 underprivileged children, in the districts of Amravati and Khandwa, become socially and financially sound. The parents of these children are majorly daily wage-workers and are not educated enough to make their children 'life-ready'.
Our 'child-participatory' curriculum involves activities that educate them about their individual rights and responsibilities to others and the importance of saving, spending and budgeting. The curriculum also increases student retention.

title: Educate & Rehabilitate 25 Deafblind Children
description: Education and rehabilitation training provided to deafblind children by Sense International (India) will enable them to improve their communication, mobility and access to information, thus improving the quality of life and supporting the families of the deafblind individuals.

title: Excellent education for 175 kids in Hyderabad!!
description: The vision of Teach For India is that one day, all children will attain an excellent education. To achieve this daunting vision, we're building a movement of leaders who will work to end educational inequity. We are seeing the impact every day, across 23,000 children. With the help of our supporters we hope to grow and see this impact across 60,000 children in the next five years.

title: Chiguru 2013
description: "Chiguru" in the regional language Kannada, means -budding. The event is conducted once a year to provide a platform for the budding future citizens to showcase their cultural talents. Over a 1500 children from government and informal schools across Bangalore (India) will participate in various traditional/cultural events. It helps facilitate the all-round and holistic development of underprivileged children and also kindles interest in volunteers from the community to engage with these children

title: vocational skills 400 childerns in2blocks in india
description: The region is dry land with agricultural labours and marginalised community economical backword. There is large number of dropouts at 10th and 11th grade schooling. Need job oriented skills training for self supplemental and job placement.Manush has infrastructure for trainings and need equipments and running cost.

title: Provide one month food for an aged person in india
description: The project provides food materials for 30 days per person covering 1000 deserted old age persons living in Tirunelveli corporation slums of Tamilnadu, India

title: Support abandoned mentally challenged girls home
description: Home for mentally challenged Girls creates a community of people who care, nurture and provides for 40 mentally challenged orphans who live at Thiruvanamali, India. We provide vocational skills for  them with doctors and nurses who take care of their physical needs and volunteers meet with them every week on a consistent basis to give them the emotional care that they need.

title: Support Poor-Needy-Handicapped-Orphans in india
description: TO MAKE AVAILABLE THE RESIDENTIAL FACILITIES, BOARDING ARRANGEMENTS, CLOTHING & MEDICAL AID TO THE PHYSICALLY HANDICAPPED, POOR NEED & HELPLESS ORPHANS 500 STUDENTS (MALE & FEMALE ) AT FREE OF CHARGE".

title: Help us save 1000 dying TB children in Tamil Nadu
description: Blossom will provide 1000 poor TB children with nutrients for 6 months being the DOTS Treatment period to get fully cured from TB. You will save 1000 precious life of children living in Tamilnadu
B L O S S O M  T R U S T

title: Help Women in India Start Small Businesses
description: Trickle Up’s program in West Bengal, India is helping extremely poor women start or expand small businesses. They are breaking the cycle of migrant labor and building stronger communities.

title: Green Riders moving out of poverty in Bihar India
description: This is a simple straightforward appeal to provide cycle rickshaws to  below the poverty line families in order to provide a vital source of income. If Bihar was a country it would be the sixth poorest in the world and a regular source of Income can make all the difference to a family struggling to put food on the table. We will provide uniforms, ID cards, basic training in English , and a brand new cycle rickshaw. One rickshaw can earn enough daily to provide 7 kg rice or 5 kg vegetables.

title: Providing safe drinking water for govt school kids
description: Children from Govt schools in India often do not have access to clean drinking water. There have many cases of children falling sick after drinking water from hand pumps or other contaminated water sources. The project is created with the objective of providing safe drinking water to these kids. We will identify & reach out to 25 schools in rural parts of Karnataka which require this support and provide a water purifier and 80 litre storage tank, which would serve the children of these schools.

title: Nutrition&Literacy for 40 tribal children in India
description: About 53 yanadi tribal families erected huts at Bheemannakonda located on the hill top near Milk Project area in Vijayawada.They are extremely away from the mainstream.Their culture,attitudes,behaviors are different from others and their life styles are more pathetic.They are the silent sufferers due to their ignorance and100% illiteracy.The families depending on collection of waste materials and fishing related activities.The plight of the children is very much underdeveloped and pitiable.

title: Cyclone Phailin Relief Fund for India
description: Cyclone Phailin struck the eastern coast of India with winds as high as 136 mph (220 km/h) and a storm surge of 11 feet (3.4 m). The storm system is half the size of India and has destroyed thousands of homes, displacing tens of thousands of people. This fund will provide emergency relief to victims.Funds will be disbursed to international and local nonprofit partners including International Medical Corps and Save the Children.

title: Training 150 Community Video Producers in india
description: The project is a community news network for the poor to accelerate social change by producing videos on their unheard stories that are shown to thousands within their communities and on TV and web.

title: The Britain-India Marathon Race Challenge
description: Multiple marathons across Britain and India to raise funds for the Salaam Baalak Trust. The trust works with street children, giving them the right to a childhood and the empowerment to develop fulfilling lives. They provide long-term, full-care residential facilities, ongoing contact point programs, an emergency telephone help line for children in distress and an educational, recreational and vocational support system. Please help me, help them.

title: Emergency Relief for Victims of Cyclone Phailin
description: International Medical Corps' Emergency Response Team is on the ground in India following Cyclone Phailin, a powerful cyclone that struck the country's east coast on October 12. International Medical Corps' emergency response doctors are on the ground, determining the needs of the more than 8 million people affected by this storm. The Indian government's preparation saved countless lives, but survivors now need emergency medical care and non-food items like tents and water purification equipment.

title: Provide 10 Orphans In India A Home Of Their Own
description: We are helping 10-12 orphan children have a safe place to call home. Our partner, Mercy Homes, provides family style, loving orphan care including education, medical care and daily nutrition. We come along side them to raise funds to build the home. Your donation provides orphans safe shelter, and ulimately a future free from crime or the sex trade. Your donation helps build safety and shelter...every child needs a safe place to call home.

title: Ensuring A Child 1 Year Education With $ 11
description: Indigenous people in North East India live under $1 a day! With no access to information, formal education, children roam the forest or are exposed to various manipulations and exploitation. Out of school children are trafficked and sold like commodities. More than 200 children were rescued in 2013 alone from individual and organizations in the pretext of giving them education or job! This project "Hold a Child" will sent indigenous children to school.

title: Relief Efforts in India
description: In 1999 a cyclone in the same area killed 10,000 people, but only 23 people are reported to have been killed by this cyclone, largely thanks to the evacuation of a million people to temporary shelters by the authorities. However, there are still very considerable humanitarian needs in the region, with nine million people affected and large numbers displaced to cyclone shelters and spontaneous camps.

title: Stopping the Slaughter. Save the Amur falcon
description: Every year, Amur falcons (Falco amurensis) fly 22,000 km from Siberia to Africa -the longest migration of any raptor. Nagaland in India is their last stop before a 3000 km-long flight across the Indian Ocean. The birds have traditionally been hunted in Nagaland during their roosting period, but last year, reports of mass killings caused consternation across the world. Addressing this issue, WTI's Rapid Action Project (RAP) has initiated activities involving villagers in protecting the falcons.

title: Drinking water for 24 villages of Thimmampalli GP
description: Water to drink is a basic need and yet 97 million people in India do not have access to safe water. We have established a community water plant working with the Thimmampalli Gram Panchayat in Chikkaballapur, Karnataka to address the issue of fluoride contaminated water, which is used by about 8000 people. We would like to provide drinking water to all 8000 people at approx 0.02 USD per liter of water but need a vehicle to supply water to villages that are at a distance of 3 to 10 kms away.

title: Essential Oils to Improve Tibetans' Health
description: Provide funding for buying and growing essential oils.  Oils are used topically to treat disease and infection at a refugee clinic in India for 380 families and over 600 Tibetan children.

title: Blue Cross of India 50th Year Rescue Fund
description: The Blue Cross of India shares it's 50th year in 2014 and this project will help fund the tireless rescue service they provide for the sick and injured animals of Chennai, India.

title: Help for handicapped and poor children in India
description: This project is maintaining good standards in providing of a full range of items such as emergency medical equipment, nutrition food,clothing and providing education to the handicapped and poor children,in Andhra pradesh ,India.
SAADHANA EDUCATIONAL AND RURAL DEVELOPMENT SOCIETY

title: Sponsor A Girl Child.
description: The project provides educational sponsorship for poor Girl children's  provides educational opportunity to girls, from socially and economically disadvantaged communities of Karnataka, marred children, children of davadasi, HIV AIDS affected orphans children, from untouchable community children's aged between 6 to 18 years. Nutrition supplementary, school uniforms ,text and note  books, life skill training from 16 year onward. Along with curricular input provided to them taking them study tour,

title: Water & Toilet Loans in Indian Villages
description: Berhampur and Aska, face a clean water & sanitation crisis. Project assists families in obtaining individual loans to build their own water tap and latrine in their home.

title: Building a first great school - in rural Karnataka
description: DRL (Developing Real Learners) is an NGO set on transforming education globally.  With a simple vision of helping all young people become the best learners they can be, DRL brings cutting-edge methodology to the poorest communities. No need for technology - simply a paradigm shift, training and support for self-sufficiency.  In Karnataka, we are building the first of many DRL schools for 300 children who otherwise would have to work and miss out on education.  One school to set the world ablaze!

title: Infrastructure for APD Resource Centre, Bangalore
description: Since 1959 The Association of People with Disability (APD) is working with People with Disability with the sole objective of facilitating and empowering them to be functionally and financially independent. We do this through Education, Vocational Training & Livelihood, Healthcare, Therapy & Mobility Aids, Advocacy and Network & Collaboration with other NGOs. At any point of time we reach out to over 25,000 people with disability across Karnataka through our institutional and community based prog
The Association of People with Disability

title: Reduce childhood malnutrition in Indian slums
description: Support a program that reduces severe malnutrition in young children living in a large slum of 17,000 people in Northern India. The program produces long term impacts by educating parents about the relationship between weight and health, and demonstrating nutritious and low cost recipes with local ingredients. Pregnant women receive pre and postnatal care to ensure that every child gets a healthy start.

title: Umang.
description: Being born HIV positive is no longer a death sentence. In Mumbai, we run a private pediatric ART center where 30 infected children have been enrolled. Here, we cover poorest of poor families who can not afford to access public health services for loss of daily wages, long distance travels, indifference/apathy,social stigma , discrimination. War is over, ravages of war continue. Qualified doctors, counselors, volunteers have taken up the challenge of up scaling it to 100 children in near future.

title: Save a Child's Life this Winter
description: The Winter Warmth Appeal gives blankets and warm clothing directly to families and children who live on the streets and in desperately poor communities in Bihar India

title: Enabling children recover from violence
description: Violence, child abuse, rape, youth suicide and crime have increased in India. Records from Government of India indicate in 2011, 33,387 juveniles ages 7-18 years were arrested, of which 2,083 were from Tamil Nadu. Behavioral science has researched the cyclic nature of violence in home, family breakdown and family poverty. With 27 years experience working with victims of such situations, SERFAC will continue working to minimize all forms of violence by education and counseling
Service And Research Institute On Family and Children(SERFAC)

title: Keep 100 At-Risk Assam Students In School
description: The goal is to help 100 students in Assam stay in school, even when there is family financial hardship. To do this, we will provide judicious monetary assistance and mentoring to the students. We work with schools that have dedicated teams with whose help we have already helped 100 other students stay in school in the last 4 years.

title: Tsunami Recovery in Five Coastal Villages, India
description: Providing post-tsunami help to 250 villagers, 20 urban families and 25 girl students for livelihoods recovery, home reconstruction, medical care and school enrollment in Kerala and Tamil Nadu, India
Mary Mother of Peace-Medjugorje Charity, Inc

title: Support Rural Children for Computer Education
description: UTKARSH School is situated in a small village called GARHI in central India. This school provides education to rural poor children's, the school run by a non profit making organization. There are 203 students from KG-I to Class 8th. The students are from tribal and other backward communities, these children's have not seen and touch the computer. School has plan to provide computer literacy to all these children's. This project will be very useful to these children in their life.

title: Provide new hope to 200 PLHIVs in Delhi
description: This project will build a health care center in Delhi for care and support to 200 PLHIVs infected from opportunistic infections(OI's). It is important to realize that HIV infection is a chronic illness with diverse clinical manifestations and psychosocial challenges and because of this OI's, death rate of PLHIV is increasing day-by-day. OI's medicine is not available in Public Health Center and this project will provide free medicine and treatment to them because of their economical condition.

title: COMMUNITY BASED POWER FENCE TO SAVE ELEPHANTS
description: Man animal conflict is a humanly challenge in wildlife management, this project secures farmers yearly livelihood & saves Asiatic Elephant (Elephas maximus). Elephants die of electrocution when farmers connect 440 volts line to farm fence. D.C powered fence will save wildlife & keeps crop raiding elephants at bay. It also helps to reduce man elephant conflict at high pressure areas surrounding Bandipur Tiger Reserve, Karnataka, India. This project builds better relation between wildlife & humans

title: Help   200  poor  students  of Tamil Nadu, India
description: This  project  helps  to provide   two  sets  of uniform  dress, 10  text  books,14 note books, one  calculator  and one  set of drawing  tools  for 200  poor engineering  diploma students  of  Sita  Rajaram  Polytechnic  College  at  Muthu Nagar, Hiraniyamangalam  Mettupatti Village,  Karur District, Tamil Nadu, India..

title: Rehabilitation of 100 Street Children in India
description: The children who loss all the chances of human love, come to the railway station and stay a period struggling for daily bread in unhealthy and oppressive conditions, with fear and submissiveness have to be considered and cared with humanity.  Rescuing them as early as possible from the railways stations and providing them chances of rehabilitation and put into mainstream of life is very essential.
Good News Ministries Jail and Prisoners Welfare Society

title: Provide a daily meal for 57 drop out children.
description: MERDS is running a school Drop Out Centre in Natham, South India.  Our 57 children are highly encouraged and motivated in their studies and extracurricular activities.  Our aim is to let these drop outs re-enter the main stream schooling system. Due to increase of food prices, we are suffering to provide a daily nutritious free meal for our students. We are searching for additional funds to keep the free meal service running. For US $ 90/year we can guarantee one child a daily meal in 2014.
Muthamil Education and Rural Development Society

title: A soliloquy of Rural women artisans
description:
Rural artisans of  Birbhum, Bankura, of West Bengal and adjacent areas of Jharkhand State are custodians 
 of great art and heritage, and the astounding variety and exquisite quality of the hand made products puts then in the niche collector's category globally. Ironically, despite in high levels of skills of these artisans and high national/ international demand for these products, the artisans associated with many crafts have been teetering on the brink of subsistence and are often forced to

title: COMPUTER TRAINING CENTRE FOR VISUALLY IMPAIRED
description: In the commercial and social scenario there is a wide scope of employment opportunities available for the partial and completely blind people in both government and private sectors.  Computer centers that provide training to these visually impaired people using a special software "JAWS" are very few and situated in proper city and are incapable of serving to a large number of such people who reside away from the main city in the rural areas.
indian multi purpose trust for the blind

title: Project  Proposal  For Innovative Rural  School"
description: It is our aim to impart education to rural children in the serene rural ambience. Provision of entrepreneurial, vocational, child-centred education is our object.  Education should be interesting, meaningful and should also be near to real life.  Further, it is our motto that financial constraints should not be a hurdle for getting proper education.  The teachers should be the friendly guides to the natural growth and development of the children.  Self reliance should come to the child from the
MALENADU EDUCATION AND RURAL DEVELOPMENT SOCIETY SIRSI

title: Women & Girl Child Empowerment Program, Hyderabad
description:
The program will 
1. Improve the health of 200 women affected by AIDS and 50 commercial sex workers by providing health education, treatment of STD's & other infections and follow-up counselling.  
2. Equip 10 AIDS affected women and 5 commercial sex workers with income generating skills and to promote the products to rehabilitate them.
3. Impart education on sex, HIV/AIDS and prevention of trafficking to 1500 adolescent girls through 50 training programs in schools and communities.

title: Skill Training for 100 poor girl youth in india
description: 100 poor girl youth beneficiaries in Punjab india under this project will train in computer skill courses namely Tally, desk top publishing, IT skill and web designing. This project will train them in computer skill which have more and more demand in marketing. And make them self reliance, self dependent

title: Supplimentry education for 50 Students in India
description:
This project will be provided notebooks and learning material; they will be taught handicrafts using waste materials. In future they will be taught vocational training according to the individual interest.
This will be provided with nutritive supplementary food to supplement in their protein and vitamin deficiency. Health screening will be done quarterly basis to monitor the effects of the above food to 50 poor students in Athipallam village of viralimalai block of pudukkottai district

title: Plant trees & Solar energy to restore globalwarmin
description: Preserving the tree is an obligation for everyone without exception, one tree will absorb approximately a ton of carbon dioxide during the course of its life cycle. Tree planting can restore global warming. Bring awareness to children. Protect the planet for our children and grand children.

title: Educate And Empower 100 Girl Children In India
description: Kidpower provides education scholarship for poor girl children and provides support in terms of academic fee, uniform, books etc. The girl children usually are from slums while their parents are mostly daily wage labour. Unable to pay the fees most of this girls drop out of school. Given the vulnerable situation of the child Kidpower empowers the child through training.The skills training program focuses on personal safety, self protection as well as personal development of the children.

title: Food & Self-Reliance for 300 orphans & handicapped
description: THIS PROJECT WILL HELP 300 NEEDY AND ORPHANS IN INDIA, TO MAKE AVAILABLE THE RESIDENTIAL FACILITIES, BOARDING ARRANGEMENTS, CLOTHING,LIVABLE SALARIES FOR TEACHERS & MEDICAL AID TO THE PHYSICALLY HANDICAPPED, POOR NEED & HELPLESS ORPHANS 300 STUDENTS.

title: Food for 200 destitute Sr. Citizens for 3 months
description: After working hard and struggling throughout for food, shelter, family, and various other things when one starts reaching an age where body and soul doesn't allow to work hard and under less privileged conditions things become even tougher. Sarthak Prayas sensed that the capital city Delhi is most unsafe for elderly and hence came up with the idea of making their lives a little better. We give monthly dry ration (includes things like Rice, Flour, Pulses, Tea leaves, Spices, Soap etc and quarterl

title: Enable the Rural Poor to Start Their Own Businesse
description:
Successful businesses break the cycle of poverty and help the poor stand on their own feet. 
MOVE, an award-winning poverty alleviation model, has trained the  poor to launch over 250 businesses  (average monthly incomes: approx. $56). MOVE entrepreneurs report improvements in social and economic status, health and nutrition, debt and dependency, and education for their children. Women entrepreneurs, in particular, report greater access and control over incomes and decision making.

title: Free Medical Care for Poor Lepers
description:
We are giving every month free chemotherapy treatment (MDT) to all detected  leprosy  cases. Every new found patient gets MDT treatment for curing the infection. This activity aims to prevent deformity through early detection and treatment.

    Physiotherapy treatment is also given to our deformed patients as well as active and passive exercises, wax baths and oil massages. Ulcer patients are getting ulcer dressing treatment and we advise these patients how to keep the limbs (hands &feet)
Madurai Health and Leprosy Relief Centre

title: Empower Women to Seek New Opportunities in India
description: Self-help groups in India provide women space to participate in training, avail new ideas, and develop self-confidence, self-esteem, & solidarity. Access to credit helps them start income generation.

title: India: Grassroots Human Rights
description: Promote Micro Finance and Micro Justice especially for the marginalized section of the society.

title: Food Security From Sustainable Agriculture, India
description: Create tangible changes in natural environment using community-based approach involving conservation and sustainable agriculture. Ensure food needs are met with livestock, horticulture, and seed-banks

title: Educational support 240 poor and tribal children.
description: SAMPARC Bhambarde school is having one hostel and 3 school buildings. The school is very important for the development of the poor and tribal children of the surrounding area and only one school is up to 12th std. for about 70 villages. Therefore the running of the school is important though it has no financial support except 5 teachers and 3 office staff salary from government. Also the hostel support which cannot be denied if education is main target for development of the area.

title: Easing Women’s Burden Through Water Security
description: Increase the availability of drinking water and irrigation for crops, reduce incidence of water borne diseases, and ease everyday drudgery on women by promoting traditional water harvesting structures

title: Immediate Need a Warm Blanket for a Old (India)
description: There is hard winter season every year in Bihar, where a lot old  single women and old age person die due to lack of winter warm clothing. But govt., local governance and society don't take care for facilities to these vulnerable old age persons. If they fall ill , also there are no one who take care and provide medical facilities. They urgently require warm clothing i.e. blanket to prevent from death due to hard cold. They live a very hard and miserable life in winter season.

title: Help Rural English Medium School for poor children
description:
SAMPARC always believe true education is the real passport for the growth and development of a child. The biggest drawback of rural area is lack of proper education and awareness regarding this. The growth of the children remains restricted because of no proper support from the parents, poverty, lack of proper food and heath. 
SAMPARC - a partner of Habitat for Humanity has developed an English Medium School in the premises of Jimmy Carter Housing Project at Patan Village near Lonavla.

title: Computer Education for Girls in Tribal Area
description: UTKARSH School is situated in a small village called GARHI in central India. This school provides education to rural poor children's, the school run by a non profit making organization. There are 203 students from KG-I to Class 8th. The students are from tribal and other backward communities, these children's have not seen and touch the computer. School has plan to provide computer literacy to all these children's. This project will be very useful to these children in their life.

title: Sponsor A 200 Girl Children India.
description: The project provides educational opportunity to orphan and vulnerable children from socially and economically disadvantaged communities including trafficked victims children, children of Devadasi, children affected by HIV/AIDS and children from excluded and Dalit communities aged between 3 to 18 years. The sponsorship programme helps support supplementary nutrition, school uniforms, text books and note books and skill training /vocational training for children from the age of 16 years.

title: Girls Not Brides: Educate & Empower Tribal Girls
description: The project is to support 100 girls of adolescent ages and young, who are married dropping out from the schools and also are in vulnerability of dropping out from schools and get married,for a better life and career and eradicate early girl children marriages among Tribals in Kolli Hills, Tamilnadu, India. This is done by supports for regular and quality education to vulnerable girl children and also providing life skills/vocational skills to young married girls and support them for self help.
Socio-Economic and Educational Development Society ( SEEDS)

title: Environmental Health Book in Tamil
description: This project is to raise the final funding needed to print & distribute 1000 copies of Hesperian's  "A Community Guide to Environmental Health" in Tamil. Adaiyaalam's translation of this book will be the first book in Tamil on environmental issues. It gives villagers methods/techniques for improving their environmental and thus their health. Adaiyaalam is a non-profit publishing group established in 1998 which focuses on women, the down-trodden, the environment and rural health issues.

title: Cloth for Work
description: Cloth is given as a motivation, with dignity, to people working on their own community issues. We turn age old charitable cloth into a resource for much needed development work in Indian villages.

title: Need an adequate food for cow preservation
description: To lead a normal and peaceful life, there is drastically needed forest preservation, water preservation, animal preservation etc.that make the earth healthy, hygienic and pollution free.Our heartiest effort is to preserve cow for mankind in society.We, the organisation have been working with this unique concept for long time because of giving high flavor in every spare of life.We think, to materialise our innovative idea in every corner of life, donor should come forward to make it grand success

title: Provide sanitary napkins for 200,000 Indian women
description: Poor women use the dirtiest rag in the house during menses. Most don’t even have enough cloth to cover themselves. We provide clean sanitary napkins made of  repurposed waste cloth (from the cities).

title: Women's Health Book in Tamil for Village Women
description: This project is to raise the final funding needed to print and distribute 1,000 copies of Hesperian's "Where Women Have No Doctor" in Tamil. This book will empower health workers and other educated women in Tamilnadu with current health information to treat and prevent common health problems experienced by women, especially in remote areas. Adaiyaalam, a non-profit publishing group established in 1998, focuses on women, the down-trodden, the environment and rural health issues.

title: $18/month for educating underprivileged poor child
description: This project aims in providing  free education to underprivileged children, both boys and girls, who are first generation learners, coming from broken or shattered homes. Providing education to them helps in eradicating child labor in the region. Sevalaya's Mahakavi Bharathiyar Higher Secondary School is a Government recognized free school, started in the year 1988 and for the past 26 years has been producing excellent results in terms of Pass percentage, top scorers and drop out ratio

title: Support children from tribal families in India
description: The project will improve the quality of life of underprivileged children,their families and communities in Mulshi Taluka,District Pune,India by ensuring education and improving the health of tribal children.Community Aid and Sponsorship Programme works with school going children in unconnected areas where the children have few opportunities for education and are in poor health.The project will provide educational support, health services and opportunities to cultivate hobbies in children.

title: Lab technician training for 15girls in South India
description: The training is supposed to educate 15 girls from rural areas in Tamil Nadu as medical lab technicians. After the training, they will have many possibilities to work in the medical field and therefore support their own families with food and money. Not only their education will increase but also their self esteem and -determination. The girls come from particularly disadvantaged families such as HIV patients or one parented families.

title: Fight against Cancer - Need of the hour
description: 10 lakh new cases of cancer occur and 7 lakh die of various forms of cancer every year in India. In Tamilnadu, burden of cancer is predicted to increase by 32 per cent in 2016, translating to 55,000 new cancer cases per year as per a study by cancer institute. 80% of the cancer patients go to a doctor at an advanced stage and this hampers the treatment. SWESTIC plans to do awareness&screening camps and referral linkages so as to facilitate early detection, timely treatment in Dindigul district.
Saraswathi Women Education Service Training Improvement Centre (SWESTIC)

title: Education for 100 Tribal children in India
description: The aim of this project - Literacy & Civic Education is to build capacities of Marginalized Poor Yanadi Tribe to be a better citizen through our Student Learning Centre program for un-enrolled working class poor children and illiterate adults to inculcate the Ethics & Civic Sense along with literacy to this community, eventually to reduce the incidence of behavioral problems, increase recreational and social opportunities to promote positive attitude for a better and responsible future citizen.
Good News Ministries Jail and Prisoners Welfare Society

title: Rescue Children from Forced Sex Work in India
description:
In CMM's orphanage, children of sex workers find a safe place away from abuse, prostitution and criminality. 
The project enables a better future to about 30 girls who would otherwise be the victims of human traffickers and forced sex work.

title: Educate 160 out of school slum children in India
description: This  project will provide enjoyable and meaningful learning experience to 160  out of school slum children in Delhi .These children are forced to miss regular school as they work as rag pickers, street vendors or help at roadside eateries to meet their family's economic needs .Many of them  stay at home to take care of their younger siblings and do household chores so that their parents can work to support the family. The project will also provide periodic health check ups of children.

title: Supporting Education for Girls in Rural India
description: Education for Equality International plans to support 15 girls' school related costs for their entire secondary education. This will include admission and exam fees, uniforms, books, stationary supplies, and transportation. Our goal for this program is to help female students continue their education and to reduce the drop-out rate.

title: Blind Students Rock Chaalo Gujarat-2014
description: Chaalo Gujarat is cultural event organized every 2 years in New Jersey to show case achievements & cultural heritage of Gujarat. About 40000 people from across the world participate in the event. During 2012, a team of 11 blind students of Blind People's Association, participated in this event. They performed 6 dance items before an audience of more than 10000 people and received a standing ovation. Our team has been invited to participate in Chaalo Gujarat to be held during 29-31 August 2014

title: Sponsor School Kits to Underprivileged Children
description: While trying to address the issues regarding enrollment of underprivileged children in Govt. schools in rural parts of India, we realised that despite Govt. education being almost free of cost, many children did not take the first step towards the school, simply because they did not have the very basic school supplies. As a humble attempt to change this situation we started a School Kit Sponsorship program. This project is now being executed yearly before the beginning of the new academic year.

title: From disability to ability with Therapy & Training
description: Project will help re-build and restore to near-normalcy the lives of around fifty cerebral palsy (CP) affected children who are brought to Balajothi Centre where we provide physiotherapy, speech-therapy, vocational training and counselling sessions to help the CP affected children become self-reliant, confident and useful individuals. Parents of CP affected children are also involved so that they are cared for in their home environment as well.

title: Provide Food And Education For A Child In India
description: Hundreds of thousands of children are at risk of malnutrition due to shortage of rain and electricity in India. This project aims to provide food and scholarships to 100 children living in poverty in rural India, so that they can get the education they need to build a brighter future and escape poverty.

title: Skill Training For 100 Poor Girl Youth In India
description: 100 poor girl youth beneficiaries in Punjab india under this project will train in computer skill courses namely Tally, desk top publishing, IT skill and web designing. This project will train them in computer skill which have more and more demand in marketing. And make them self reliance, self dependent

title: Unlocking potentials of children in abject Poverty
description: To educate girl children in the rural areas through informal school-E-caravan-     the project will bridge the gap between Rural girls and Modern Educational facilities, to provide the latest Information and Communication Technology ( ICT) as well as to extend Innovative sustainable project at their door step and to reduce the cost, Time and energy for overall empowerment & development of girl children is the idea of the project.

title: ENGLISH AS A TOOL OF POVERTY ALLEVIATION
description:
This Project will launch 5 Wi-Fi  Language Class on Wheel for under privileged students in 5 most poor states of India to develop their English Speaking and employ them in major companies & encourage entrepreneurship through LEDER.
Lead India Foundation will train 500 under privileged students in the slums and very remote areas of India to uplift their living standard through training them and developing their skill in English Language and promote their enterprise skill through LEDER program

title: Help Cerebral Palsy (CP) affected children
description: Project will help re-build and restore to near-normalcy the lives of around fifty cerebral palsy (CP) affected children who are brought to Balajothi Centre where we provide physiotherapy, speech-therapy, vocational training and counselling sessions to help the CP affected children become self-reliant, confident and useful individuals. Parents of CP affected children are also involved so that they are cared for in their home environment as well.

title: Aashrya- Shelter for HIV infected children at high
description: Ajit Foundation has identified 4 blocks in periphery 45 Km of Solpur district place, where 2000 children are HIV infected and required support. We have closely monitored and analyzed that these children required emotional, social and economic supports to survive healthy life. Shelter for 500 HIV infected children, will provide all required services under one roof. This project will ensure all services which are include medical treatment,  counselling, education and socialization support

title: Free Medical Care for Poor Lepers
description:
We are giving every month free chemotherapy treatment (MDT) to all detected  leprosy  cases. Every new found patient gets MDT treatment for curing the infection. This activity aims to prevent deformity through early detection and treatment.

    Physiotherapy treatment is also given to our deformed patients as well as active and passive exercises, wax baths and oil massages. Ulcer patients are getting ulcer dressing treatment and we advise these patients how to keep the limbs (hands &feet)
Madurai Health and Leprosy Relief Centre

title: Van for Custom footwear for Leprosy Patients
description: This project will support a Mobile Medical Van Unit (MMV Unit)  enabled with the capacity to fabricate custom protective footwear for persons suffering from leprosy related disability and deformity of the feet, living in remote, rural and vulnerable parts of the country.

title: Stop the polio outbreak in India
description: This project provides funding for essential social mobilization items needed to conduct high-quality polio immunization in India including media, posters, advertisements and volunteer caps and aprons.

title: uplift and empower the victims of patriarchy
description: to empower and mainstreamise the most stigmatised and discreminated women. They are sweepers, dumping ground workers, sex workers, trafficked women and HIV+ women, through micro-entrepreneurship and financial inclusion program and community leadership program. the project will  provide micro-entrepreneurship training to 20 women peers to lead 20+ groups from the above discriminated communities, advocate their cause for financial inclusion and link them with banks, and give micro skill support.

title: Support children Affected and infected with HIV
description: HLFPPT has worked extensively in Andhra Pradesh on prevention and care in HIV / AIDS among Most At Risk Population, including Vulnerable women and children. Facilitating emergence and development of Community Bases Organizations' (CBOs) is one such initiative we have undertaken in AP. HLFPPT is planning to provide vulnerable infected and affected children with counseling, nutrition support & back to school facilitation and linkages to government programs and vocational institutes.
Hindustan Latex Family Planning Promotion Trust

title: vocational education to 70 poorest women in india
description: Economic Empowerment of the dropout women's through vocational training livelihood project intends to give skill training in Bag making & tailoring for sustainable livelihoods to 70 women's with this vocational skills training women live with dignity by earning themselves. During this training, beneficiaries will learn and develop skills in bag making and tailoring work. They can earn 6000 - 8000 Rs. Every month. We provide sewing machine, tool kit to survive on their own and live with dignity.

title: Food & Self-Reliance for 300 orphans & handicapped
description: THIS PROJECT WILL HELP 300 NEEDY AND ORPHANS IN INDIA, TO MAKE AVAILABLE THE RESIDENTIAL FACILITIES, BOARDING ARRANGEMENTS, CLOTHING,LIVABLE SALARIES FOR TEACHERS & MEDICAL AID TO THE PHYSICALLY HANDICAPPED, POOR NEED & HELPLESS ORPHANS 300 STUDENTS.

title: RAKSHA (Protection and Restoration 50 Survivors)
description: Thousands of girls affected by poverty, disaster and lack of opportunities got trafficked from West Bengal. More than 800 sex trafficked victims who were rescued by GGBK from dehumanizing slavery like conditions will be restored dignity through psycho-social support and economic empowerment for a safe and dignified life in the society.

title: Steer to Change
description: We need to provide women with the environment and the skills to be empowered, to live a life of dignity, independence and self-worth. Women have the right to fulfil their immense potential and reach out for their dreams. Providing the chance of a rewarding career, whilst also challenging societal constraints on marginalised women will contribute to the individuals and wider community's progression.

title: Basic Education for the children of slum-dwellers
description: The rural poor and unskilled workers migrate to the city in search of livelihood, as the employment in the unskilled sector is high.  But due to the costly city life and higher rentals, these poor people form into groups and build make shift houses in the suburbs or open places which finally become slum areas due to the unorganised, unplanned occupation and living. These poor migrants who live a hand to mouth life by earning very little on daily labour and miserable living conditions make them.

title: Ensure food security for 500 households in India
description: The project is scaling up traditional sustainable livelihoods to ensure food security for 500 underprivileged households who live in the fringes of the remotest Protected Forest Areas in northeastern India. Recurring flood and inaction of Wildlife Protection Act had made their livelihood earning extremely difficult. The project is strengthening the women of the poor households by providing trainings, free initial materials & equipments and facilitates access to micro-finances & markets.

title: Provide Bicycles for Poor Students in India
description: Our project is providing 300 bicycles and shoes to 300 students --150 boys and 150 girls--to help them go to school in poor coastal areas of Kerala, India.
Mary Mother of Peace-Medjugorje Charity, Inc

title: Empowerment of 300 Street Children in India
description: This project will provide 300 street children in Vellore, Tamilnadu State, South India, with alternative education, vocational skill training, health and nutritional care and social and entrepreneurship  skill development thereby reducing negative impact of vulnerable environment on them by 2018.

title: The Maya Musical: Find your Light
description: The Maya Musical is a story of our journey to find our light. Maya, a partnership between Teach For India and Artists Striving to End Poverty, is an original script, with Broadway composed music that tells the story of Princess Maya's journey. Tasked to bring light back into her Kingdom, Maya and her friends use the values of courage, compassion and wisdom to lift 3 great curses that have been cast on the world. The show will open in November 2014.

title: Hope Abides
description: Imagine you live in a country where 40% of the population  lives on less than $1.25/day; now imagine you are an orphan with no one to provide even this meager level of sustenance. This is the reality of more than 25 million orphans in India.  An education is the best tool a child can have to escape poverty. Hope Abides provides hope and help to these orphans and other destitute children and is seeking funding to assist these children with education and other basic needs.

title: Educate and Empower 500 Women & Girls in India
description: Through training we will empower the women with skills to improve their income. We teach life skills and sex education to adolescent girls so they can improve their quality of life.
Center for Women's Development and Research

title: COMMUNITY BASED POWER FENCE TO SAVE ELEPHANTS
description: Man animal conflict is a humanly challenge in wildlife management and biodiversity conservation in India, this project secures farmers yearly livelihood & saves Elephant (Elephas maximus). 15,000 houses 10,00,000 ha of crops damage stay evidence of conflict every year. Due to anger and hardship farmers connect 440 volts electric line to farm fence, 200 Elephants die of electrocution and 200 humans die of conflict. Solar power fence will save wildlife, reduce man elephant conflict.

title: Agriculture training for India's low castes
description: The program will help more than 50,000 people in 43 villages to feed and support themselves through sustainable agriculture training with an emphasis on opportunities for women.

title: Enhancing skills for 1000 women in Bihar
description: The project will provide suitable skill training for 1000 poor women in rural Bihar so their income earning capacity increases and improves their economic situation.

title: Turning waste into wealth for 1000 households
description: Engaging 1000 households in solid waste management, thereby improving the living environment for poor people as well as rejuvenating soil and safeguarding agricultural biodiversity.

title: One time food for 10 children in Mugular hostel
description:
Vidyanikethan Mugulur hostel for orphans consist of 10 children, who are being rehabilitated at the school through non-formal education and raising awareness of the child rights issues. The school also accommodates for life skills and encourages their participation in sports and extra curricular activities. They are provided with healthy and nutritious meals three times daily. 

The funding which is sanctioned by the department is insufficient for the proposed running of the hostel.

title: Education for Underprivileged Indian Girls
description: In Indian society girls are often denied chances for personal growth and education, creating a variety of lifelong struggles.  The Janani Home offsets this gender discrimination by creating a safe and structured environment for underprivileged girls to pursue their studies and particular interests.  We want to remove limitations, and provide opportunities for these girls to reach their highest potential.  The Home currently serves 11 girls, but we hope to expand as support increases.

title: Tailoring Training for 50 Muslim Women in India
description: This project will directly benefit 50 Muslim women in Lucknow, India by teaching them basic tailoring and embroidery skills. Women will also learn design skills, and how to promote and market their manufactured garments. These new professional skills will enhance their employability and capacity to earn more income. Bottom line: the success of the women results in their daughters being educated and wives being respected by their in-laws.

title: Save Elephant Calves from Drowning in Unused Wells
description: The villagers of Chota Changru, Bara Changru, and Bantha Reladih in Jharkhand in Eastern India are farmers and use wells to irrigate their fields. Once their use is over, the wells are abandoned. With no fencing around them and the mouth almost hidden by tall weeds, these wells quickly turn into deathtraps for elephant herds crossing the area. In the past two years, five elephant calves have fallen into these wells. Of these, three were rescued in time, but two were not so lucky and drowned.

title: Pathari Village Project for Indian farmers
description: A farmer in India commits suicide every 41 minutes. You can make a difference. We plan to repair canal in Pathari village of Vidarbha, Maharashtra, India, that connects to reservoir in coming months which will allow village of 1300 people harvest second crop,create small business opportunities for youth of the village and help  about 400+ livestock in the village.

title: Health & Hygiene Support for 500 Poor Girls
description: This project will improve the health & hygiene of 500 less fortunate adolescent girls in Amritsar district of Punjab in India. Health services and medical check-ups will be provided for a period of three months.

title: "Replace a TEAR with a SMILE of a Sextrafficked"
description: Through this project,Orphan vulnerable girls and girl children of sexually abused women are identified and rescued and given a safe place away from abuse, prostitution and criminality. The project enables a better future to about 3000+  young girls  who would otherwise be the victims of human traffickers and subjected to forced sexual slavery.

title: No Child marriages in 50 villages of India
description: CSI conducts village level workshops for adolescent girls to train them on basic  life skills like assertive communication, negotiation, problem solving and conflict resolution  thus enabling  girls to speak up, advocate for themselves, make better decisions and aspire to alternatives to early marriage. We also engage with gatekeepers like parents and community elders  --through meetings, information campaigns, role plays etc.-as they are the key people who decide when and whom a girl marries.

title: Empower 90 Youth as Waste Wise Managers in Dimapur
description: PRO RURAL leads a campaign for environment conservation with youth. A group of needy and vulnerable youth who are school drop outs and migrants are trained as WASTE WISE MANAGERS. They are formed into a self managing group who creates awareness on best practices of waste management in 27 wards of Dimapur City. They plan to develop their livelihood through user charges while helping in a door to door waste collection for the municipal. Here the group needs equipment and some starter fund.

title: LIVELIHOOD FOR THE CYCLONE AFFECTED 1000 FAMILIES
description: After cyclone phailin the poor SC, ST, and OBC people were helpless by loosing their house and belongings. Through this project  300 cyclone affected families will get shelter and 700 families will be economically empowered and improve the standard of living condition in Baliapal Block of Balesore District , india

title: Self-reliance & Resilience in Slum Women's Groups
description: The Urban Health Resource Centre works to strengthen the communities of the 300,000 slum dwellers in Agra and Indore in India to increase their access to maternal/child health services, proof of address, education, improved living environment, and state-provided services. UHRC does this by promoting the establishment of grassroots women's groups in slums and providing technical training and skills development workshops to the groups, thus developing self-efficacy among slum communities.

title: Village Learning Centers for 5000 Beneficiaries
description: Build a Village Library/Learning Centers for supplementary and vocational education and a place for communities to organize coalition for economic development and infrastructure planning.

title: Backyard Nutrition Garden for 1000 Poor Families
description: VAAGDHARA aims to raise 1,000 Backyard Nutrition Garden with 1000 poor tribal families to help fighting malnutrition among girls, women and children. Poor families look for mid day meal, PDS and other supplementary nutrition systems. Nutritional trees can provide good growth by supply of desired nutrition and ultimately help poor in fighting malnutrition. These trees will also absorb carbon dioxide and help slowing down of global warming. Protect our planet, children and grandchildren.
vaagdhara (Voluntary Association of Agricultural General Development,Health and Recons.Alliance)

title: Support 300 destitute Children in India
description: This project supports street children, orphan and destitute in Goa. There are so many run away children from different states, migrate to Goa in search of better livelihood options. In bargain of doing so they end up as child laborers, rag pickers and juvenile in conflict with Law. Children's home provides them an environment with all the basic necessities required for their healthy growth. El Shaddai has 6 homes, supporting 300, girls and boys, in age group of 2-17 years. We need your support!

title: Feed 50 Needy Indian Children from Organic Garden
description: Ecological cultivation of vegetable, spinach, fruits in lawn garden will help 50 needy children from family of poor minority of West Bengal to reduce hunger and undernutrition and enable those children to get an education and be healthier. Parents and family members will learn growing cost effective and safe organic lawn garden and secure food for children. They plough vegetable, spinach, fruits in the gardens and save food for disaster situation. These also create fodder for livestock.

title: Help 200 rape survivors for justice in India
description: In India, 3,09,546 crimes against women were reported in year 2013, including 33,707 rape cases. 13.1% victims were girls under 14 years of age. They face "additional victimization"-social stigma, and dehumanizing experiences with medical, police, and judicial processes heighten their trauma.  Jan Sahas will support 200 survivors by providing immediate relief, medical treatment, shelter and counseling, legal support and finally, to demanding implementation of court judgments.

title: Support immunization of 42971 children in India
description: Only 56% of the children in India get full immunization. For 1 in every 20 children in India, the 1st birthday might never happen.   To address the problem, CRY is focusing on ensuring complete immunizations for 42,430 children between the ages of 0 - 12 months in 3500 villages across India, during the month of July and August, by 1. Providing access to life saving immunization to the children in 3500 villages  2. Ensuring well equipped health centers and early childhood care centers

title: Support 1 Year Children Education With $11
description: Indigenous people in North East India live under $1 a day! With no access to information, formal education, children roam the forest or are exposed to various manipulations and exploitation. Out of school children are trafficked and sold like commodities. More than 200 children were rescued in 2013 alone from individual and organizations in the pretext of giving them education or job! This project "Hold a Child" will sent indigenous children to school.

title: Support 5000 women out of sexual & economic abuse
description: ‘Untouchable’ women face caste-based sexual & economic abuse & domestic violence.The project enables women in 100 villages develop economic independence & raise their voice against injustice.

title: Micronutrients in Soymilk for 15,000 Kids-Orissa
description: This project provides 200ml of micro-nutrient enriched soymilk to 15,000 primary school students 6 days a week with 20 sets of non-electric equipment (VitaGoats) run by women's Self-Help Groups.

title: Expanding care to people living with HIV/AIDS
description: Project provides HIV/AIDS medical care, referrals, counselling, home based care for affected persons and families

title: Sponsor A Girl Child
description: The project gives educational sponsorship to poor girls, providing educational opportunity to girls from socially and economically disadvantaged communities, to orphans, children of child labour, and  HIV/AIDS affected, aged between 1 to 18 years. Nutrition supplementary, school uniforms, text and note books, life skill training from 16 year onward. Along with curricular input provided to them and taking them on study tour.

title: SCHOOL FILTER PROJECT - 2706 children in INDIA
description: We are working for the downtrodden community. The women and children are more vulnerable. The targeted area have no water access or sanitaries facilities. The children are facing a lot of health problems. For them, providing safe drinking water is a must. The provision of filter units to the school children will improve the health, which in turn have a positive impact in the school attendance record. For sustainability, Child Watsan Committees will be formed to maintain these filters.

title: From Child Labour to School
description: Poverty and hunger prevent children from going to school and work as child labour. The situation is worse in rural areas. In view of this situation, we run a school for the underprivileged children at Belabahol village in Purulia district of India where all children are from underprivileged sections, most of whome work as child labours in agricultural firms. Object is not only to provide quality education but also to provide nutritional food, books etc thus creating a conducive learning environm

title: Education and nutrition for 530 Indian children
description: Manav Sadhna runs an after school education program for more than 500 children living in Ahmedabad's largest slum, providing free education focusing on values, as well as providing milk and one nutritious snack each day.

title: Support 200 Women SHG Micro Entrepreneurs
description: The proposed  project aims to provide seed capital to poor Women entrepreneurs to fulfil their credit requirements and thereby free them from the clutches of local money lenders, who charges exorbitant rate of interest. This project aims to achieve economic development of the beneficiary thereby attempting to reverse the age-old vicious cycle of "low income, low savings, and low investment".We will work through women's SHG groups as women are the most vulnerable section of the society.

title: Education for tribal children in rural Rajasthan
description: This project aims to ensure that rural tribal children in Udaipur District, Rajasthan are able to receive a solid education, providing them with the skills they need to succeed in life. It will work through a 3-pronged approach, enrolling children in school and reducing instances of child labor, ensuring that children can easily get to school through providing escorts in remote areas, and ensuring children remain in school through holding school fairs and constructing sanitation facilities.

title: Providing Education for 100 girls in Andhra
description: This project presently provides primary English medium education for 68 girls from an urban slum in India so that they can attain the skills necessary for better employment and hence a better life.

title: Rehabilitation of Partial Disabled Cows
description: In india Cows are treated as God by Hindu Community.In Rural areas,People,Partially illiterate,Use to shelter the cows mainly for milk production.They are Practising the anncient method for providing food and health hygyne to those innocent animals.They trated them as a productive tools not as a creature.So when the cows get herted use to realease them quickly from shelter or sell them to slaughter house.Our organisation with the view to serve the animal has taken up a project to provide shelter

title: WOMAN CENTER: Woman Opportunity MANagement
description: A holistic approach to empowering deprived women.

title: Nurturing grassroots innovations
description: The project will incubate rural innovations by enabling and offering business development services to innovators and entrepreneurs

title: Ending Child Sexual Violence In120 Indian Villages
description: In India, just 3% of child rape and sexual abuse cases reach the police. Utthan is going to work with ex-victims and local leaders to create an environment that can tackle the problem of sexual violence head-on. We will begin by training 60 community leaders to provide gender sensitive and informed support to victims of child rape and sexual abuse in 120 villages.They will play a key role in overcoming the extreme social stigma and victim-blaming culture that prevents victims from speaking out.

title: Send Sheetal from Red-Light Area to US Drum School
description: Hi, I'm Sheetal! I'm 19, in 10th grade and I love to dance and play drums. A normal teenage life? Yes, but I grew up in Mumbai's red-light area. I am the daughter of a sex worker and I've never met my dad. I'm still in 10th because I've only been to school 3 years of my life. I faced a lot of violence, rape and discrimination....But I have big dreams! I want to go to a music school in the US for drumming diploma so I can start music classes in the red-light area. Will you help me get to the USA?

title: Home for 20 domestic abuse survivors- Aizawl,India
description: This project will provide a 'Safe Home' for 20 women survivors of domestic and gender violence in remote Zemabawk village in Aizawl, Mizoram, a north eastern state of India. Lalthanzami from Aizawl, Mizoram is a survivor of domestic violence herself. She now works with women facing similar situations in and around her village.  Through this project, the Safe Home run by her will be able to provide dignity, shelter, food, legal counselling, livelihood skills and leadership training to 20 women
