Foundation for Social Transformation - enabling north east india

title: Chiguru-A Cultural Event for Govt School Children
description: "Chiguru", in the regional language Kannada, means "budding", and the project aims at providing a platform for the budding future citizens to showcase their cultural talents. Over a 2000 children from government and informal schools across Bangalore (India) will participate in various traditional/cultural events. It helps facilitate the all-round and holistic development of underprivileged children and also kindles interest in volunteers from the community to engage with these children.

title: Skill Training for 100 poor girls in india
description: 100 poor girl youth beneficiaries in Punjab india under this project will train in computer skill courses namely Tally, desk top publishing, IT skill and web designing. This project will train them in computer skill which have more and more demand in marketing. And make them self reliance, self dependent

title: Community Based Rehabilitation
description: Vidya Sagar's CBR program ( since 1990 ) aims at sharing the technical knowledge and skills on rehabilitation( capacity building ) and reach out to as many persons with disability, irrespective of their location and socio - economic background ,ensuring access to appropriate services. The CBR team with 5 projects reaches out to 28 community workers, more than 150 persons with disabilities, their families and the community.

title: Education and hygiene for students with Sp. needs.
description: This project will help the students of special school of Blind welfare council to live a better and healthy life. The students here are with down syndrome, cerebral palsy, mental disabilities, multiple disabilities and also with hearing impairment. All are from economically poor background and they come from tribal area. In last 7 years our special school - trained staff has changed many lives. Two of them are Neelam and Girish; played in Asia Pacific Special Olympics held in Australia in 2013.

title: Provide the housing to leprosy patients in India
description: This project will build the individual house to providing the women leprosy deformed patients in Madurai District, India.  because this leprosy patients are living in damaged  hut, shelters and tiled houses. Now in India has the rainy season, so rain water comes in the house through damaged roof. through this 'LOW PRICE HOUSING  project' 35 leprosy women patients will be benefited in 18 villages in our project area.
Madurai Health and Leprosy Relief Centre

title: COMMUNITY BASED POWER FENCE TO SAVE ELEPHANT
description: Man animal conflict is a challenge in wildlife management and biodiversity conservation in India. This project secures farmers' yearly livelihood & saves the elephant (Elephas maximus). 15,000 houses and 10,00,000 ha of crops damage stay as evidence of conflict every year. Due to anger and hardship, farmers connect 440 volts electric line to farm fence, 200 Elephants die of electrocution and 200 humans die of conflict. Solar power fence will save wildlife, reduce man elephant conflict.

title: Help orphans in India
description: This project will help our orphan girls with education, clothes, food and a house.

title: Balya- A home for 60+ Orphan children - Bangalore
description: This project provides the orphans with comfortable shelter, nutritious food, decent clothing and valuable education which will help them grow to be responsible citizens of this world. This school currently provides free education to 60+ orphan kids and other 30+ kids who cannot afford education within the vicinity of the orphanage. This project will help us with our endeavor to provide them with nutritious food, shelter, clothing and sustained education for a month.

title: Special Footwear for Persons affected by Leprosy
description: AIFO India will provide 1000 pairs of special MCR ( Micro Cellular Rubber ) footwear to persons who are suffering from Leprosy related deformity of the foot in rural and remote Assam, North East India .

title: "Show your support,Educate a Child now in India."
description: India is shining whereas,81,50,618 children aged 8 to13 years are still out of school.Kids in India are currently being exposed to neglect,homelessness,human trafficking,educational problems,physical and sexual abuse.Education being one of  their basic rights.Through this project,we intended to provide  about 500 youths  the School Materials,language classes,IT skills,Life Skills which will encourage them for building their career and to be competitive to be a good human being as a whole.

title: Support for the Distressed Elderly women,India
description: This is a support programme for 100 elderly women who are most  neglected.The overall goal of the project is to better the living condition of the distressed elderly women .The project will be implemented at 30 backward & remote  villages in Baliapal Block in Balasore district of  Odisha In India.The vulnerable and poorest of the poor elderly women who have nobody  to look after are the target group of the project.From this project poor elderly women will be provided with basic needs  of life.

title: A toilet block to Leela Family Home ,Karnata India
description: Summary Summary Leela Family Home (LFH) is fostering 40 under privileged children for their overall development in Bangarpet of Kolar District in Karnataka, South India. LFH takes care of the the children's food, health, shelter and education, but inadequate sanitation facility. Currently, there are 2 toilets available but inadequate to meet the needs of 40 children coming from poor rural families. Your contribution will help this project to construct 4 toilet cum bathrooms and meet the demands.

title: Provide Food And Education For A Child In India
description: Hundreds of thousands of children are at risk of malnutrition due to shortage of rain and electricity in Thiruvannamalai, Tamil Nadu. This project aims to provide food and scholarships to 100 children living in poverty in rural India, so that they can get the education they need to build a brighter future and escape poverty.

title: English as a Tool For Poverty Alleviation
description: This Project will launch 5 Wi-Fi  Language Class on Wheel for under privileged students in 5 most poor states of India to develop their English Speaking and employ them in major companies & encourage entrepreneurship through LEDER. Lead India Foundation will train 500 under privileged students in the slums and very remote areas of India to uplift their living standard through training them and developing their skill in English Language and promote their enterprise skill through LEDER program

title: FOOD, CLOTH AND EDUCATION FOR 40 POOR CHILDREN
description: This Education Project is to provide Food, Cloth and Education to 40 Poor Children aims to provide care, support and protection for 40 semi street & street poor children. This Project has three care takers, one teacher. a doctor is conducting health check-up & providing medicines. All the inmates are being provided with 3 time's nutritious food, one set of books and 2 sets of uniforms. Every child has opportunity for indoor and out-door recreation and play facilities along with training in craft

title: Care and Education for Orphan Children in India
description: The proposal is for supporting 25 orphans and poor children in urban areas in Hyderabad, Andhra Pradesh, India for provision of food, shelter, clothing and education  in Home based environment to bring them up to become self reliant and sustainable. The children in the target areas do not have an opportunity to pursue their education because their poverty. Several Indian children are in the State of degradation and misery.

title: Fighting Cyclone Hudhud creates havoc
description: On 13th of October, Cyclone Hudhud has left a trail of destruction in Vishakapatnam. It destroyed the premises of Lebenshilfe, and the lives of many are in danger. It made landfall in Visakhapatnam and surrounding areas and left a huge pile of debris and trees behind.  The Project Fighting Cyclone Hudhud will help us rebuild the premises of Lebenshilfe for the safety of the inhabitants and help the children live a nornal life again.

title: School for training Children with Special Needs
description: Aruna Chetana School for Children with Special Needs is a model for many schools in the state of Karnataka, India. It has been helping children with multiple retardation, special needs, and cerebral palsy for past twenty-five years and counting. The philosophy with which this school is started is that all children regardless of mental disabilities, learning disabilities, and genetic disorders have a basic fundamental right to live a life with dignity and have got right to education.

title: Business School for Rural Women in Maharashtra
description: The Business School provides technical skills to rural women without formal education and to girls forced to drop out of school, enabling them to start and/or improve their own micro enterprises.

title: Give Life to 140 Indian Orphans and Needy Children
description: 99 children up to 5th grade attend Dazzling Stone School and the other 40 older children study in outside schools and one baby. Children receive free accommodation, clothes and education.

title: Education and Protection Center for 200 Children
description: 2007, after the mass murder,disappearance of children of migrant labor from Nithari village, Noida, UP, India, parents from poor, backward communities were frightened about the safety of their children. MERA SAHARA Centre for non formal Education; Skill formation, Protection was started by us with local community support. It functions as a preparatory school, a bridge between non-formal and formal education. It sucessfully prevents child trafficking, labor & marriage, and needs financial support

title: computer education to 100 students in kishanganj
description: AIF  is running computer lab with 5 computers in  district Kishanganj. This block is selected with in close vicinity of high and middle schools. AIF is imparting 3 months basic computer course keeping in mind the learning ability of the students who belong to marginalized and poor sections of the society.  The center is running 2 hours class for  students. 3 batches are running every day thrice a week. The  centre will  impart computer education to 100 students in the second year

title: Safe Water & Latrines for Village in India
description: Enable the community of Keelakarthigaipatti to improve their health and use their time for economic development by building and maintaining a sustainable safe water & sanitation system.

title: Hudhud relief fund for 500 very poor families
description: The severe Cyclonic storm Hudhud was the strongest tropical cyclone of 2014 that resulted into unending damages in Vizag and the nearby areas. The misery of the people hardly has an end. The cyclone took thousands of life, as it hit the coastal district of Andhra Pradesh. . The city of Vizag has undergone a loss of almost Rs. 70,000 crore, while the rest of the losses are yet to be estimated. Almost 84 deaths are being confirmed.

title: Preserving Himalayan Mountain Drops- India
description: "Preserve Mountain Drops" is our initiative to save and recharge 10 fresh water springs in district Solan of Himachal Pradesh, North India. These springs were perennial source of fresh water for residing population and local wild life. In recent times they have turned seasonal where few have even dried out. Their importance towards natural biodiversity cannot be measured. Under this project we will install counter measures to recharge and protect identified springs using holistic approach.

title: Support 50 rural schools to network with scholarly
description: This project is aiming to network 50 rural marginalized schools (10,000 students) in Vidarbha with nationally and Internationally scholar schools and to motivate and update them with various competitions, opportunities, exams, recent educational developments and education related stuff by publishing weekly newspaper dedicated to school education and activities.

title: Teach 250 children basic reading and arithmetic
description: Despite 97% enrollment in schools, less than 50% of children can't read or do arithmetic at their grade level.  The absence of basic numeracy and literacy skills in the early grades creates an extremely weak foundation for future learning.  Pratham has innovated a model of 'learning camps' where children are tested and grouped by proficiency rather than grade or age and then taught basic reading and arithmetic.

title: Saving Lives, Human-Snake Conflict Mitigation
description: Even with under-reporting of snake bites, 126 people die each day due to snake-bites in India, while the total number of annual snake-bites are estimated to be around 1.4 million (bite to death ratio is 64:1). Victims are mainly farmers and farm laborers working or living in agricultural environments. Majority of these bites can be avoided with some basic precaution and proactive thinking. Awareness about right first aid and clinical treatment options can also bring down deaths or loss of limbs.

title: Saving Children from Adult Exploitation:Facilities
description: Establish a boarding school for 100 boys and girls and 200 day scholars. This project provides for the physical facilities needed by the school.
M. K. Gandhi Institute for Nonviolence

title: Saving Children from Adult Exploitation: Program
description: This project provides program development for a boarding/day school to serve the education and employment needs of 400 poor village children.
M. K. Gandhi Institute for Nonviolence

title: Winter wear for 55 worthy orphans
description: This project wil help to provide  some winter wear for our kids with your support. The Winter wear is sold by the migrants of Nepal. The cost of a blanket and a sweater is $ 25. All of this money will go directly towards a Winter wear, clothes and foot wear for the children to share, and any other important needs the children home deem pertinent. These are the ways we're seeking to fill in the hopes of injecting more creativity, fun, and happiness into the children's daily lives.

title: Quality education for Muslim Children in Madarsa
description: Integrated Approach to Technology in Education (ITE) in 20 Madarsa as a Model in Varanasi and Jaunpur  Madarsa students specially to girls.Improve Learning Processes and Pedagogy: The technology as an information processing tool takes away the traditional information giving role of the teacher. This basic functionality of technology by default requires the teachers to take a facilitative than an informative role. The ITE approach requires the teachers to play a central role.

title: Saving Children from Adult Exploitation:Operations
description: Establish a boarding school for 100 boys and girls and 300 day scholars. This project provides for the ongoing operations of the school for one year.
M. K. Gandhi Institute for Nonviolence

title: Promoting SRHR of among 5000 youth in TN, India
description: Protect 5000 youth from STI through enhancement of their understanding of Sex and Sexuality related issues and an orientation on SRHR.   Create a sustainable peer based first contact referral process for those youth with vulnerable sexual behavioral patterns. Equip 200 youth (each year 100) to serve as peers and ensure that the vulnerable youth are identified counselled, treated, and offered legal help where and integrated into mainstream institutional programmes sustained support over 2 years

title: Change the Lives of orphans,Poor children in India
description: Theressa Home for children aims to changing the lives of Orphans and providing shelter, food, Clothing, Medical care, Education, love for orphans and needy children. Now Theressa home have 23 children.These children belong to really poor segment of the society. We want to give them hope,opportunity and bright future.

title: HIV/AIDS intervention for Vulnerable Children
description: Reaching out to 1500 street children to provide nutrition, recreational, educational and health services and awareness, at the drop in center (DIC). Provides detox and rehab to children as well.
Sharan Society for Service to Urban Poverty

title: Sponsor tribal girl student's college education
description: This project will support 100 tribal girl student's of JR College Phalasia to get college education in tribal populated area of Udaipur district of Rajasthan State. It is deprived and remote area.Their parents are not in condition to pay college fees. Your help can change girls life to become self dependent.

title: Care Home for HIV Impacted Children Kolkata,India
description: 25 children, infected by HIV and affected by the disease, directly benefit from this project. We offer them a loving, safe and secure environment in which they can receive healthcare and nutrition and engage in education, building the foundations for a productive and happy life. Approximately, a further 100 people will indirectly benefit as we work with family members, neighbours, the wider community and service sector officials to create awareness and decrease stigma.

title: Mobile health to 50,000 tribes in Denkanikota
description: aim: Curative and referral support to below poverty line people in remote and tribal villages-120 nos,    Objectives: identify, treat and or refer clinical, medical and surgical cases to complete cure and render follow up at household level and ensure continuation of their daily and development goals.  activities: diagnostic support, treatment, referral and follow up of patients esp women, children and the elderly.   methodology: daily visit, medical camps, transport & follow up.

title: 100 STREET CHILDREN REHABILITATION IN INDIA
description: The children at risk are a major social problem in the society which needs to be given due to consideration to address their problems of the children. The children in menace are not able to enjoy their legitimate right to play associate and educate. In this connection, Mother Society realized the need in rescuing the abandoned and runaway children and observed the growing intensity of the problem of massive migration of the rural children into city as an worrying phenomenon.
MOTHER SOCIETY (Miracle Organisation Towards Health & Education Remedial Society)

title: HOSTEL FOR BLIND OLD AGE , CHILDREN AND GIRL
description: INDIAN MULTI PURPOSE TRUST FOR THE BLIND IS THE FIRST NGO IN INDIA. WHO WORKS FOR THE BLIND FAMILIES SINCE LAST 14 YEARS .We give special attention and care to the blind persons after their marriage and when they are in the process of settling down as a family. The real problem starts when they marry a similar partner, have kids and try to settle in some remote rural area because of financial constraint as no organization of hostel houses such families.
indian multi purpose trust for the blind

title: SHELTER FOR 30 ORPHANED GIRLS IN BANGALORE, INDIA
description: We want to attract donors who will help in securing shelter for 30 very poor and orphaned children at our Ashanilaya Orphanage in Bangalore, India. Remember: Your contribution can change the life of these children! Our impact on these unfortunate children - who did not choose to be orphaned themselves - will be immense as their future will be secured. Proper shelter, food and clothing are important parts of growing up for any child. Your contribution will help a child be able to help itself.
MASARD - Mass Based Association for Social Services & Rural Development

title: chandana is a school  for farmers and rural poor
description: Chandana is a play-way model school situated in Narebail village, about 7 K.M.s from Sirsi town.   Here pre-school, primary and secondary education is rendered in a meaningful, child-centred and activity based manner.   Our motto is to provide quality education to farmers and rural poor children to enable them to develop physically and emotionally as healthy, thinking and creative individuals, who can intelligently and sensitively face the challenges of the future.
MALENADU EDUCATION AND RURAL DEVELOPMENT SOCIETY SIRSI

title: Take 50 poor kids from streets to school in India
description: The project is working towards rescuing poor kids and orphans from streets and child labour in Pandesara - industrial area of Surat, India. We admit these kids to our primary school - Pearl's Nursery Academy - running under UBNMET NGO. So far we have 150 students studying completely free of charge and we want to help more children.
Urmila Brundaban Nayak Memorial Education Trust

title: Livelihood for 500 Tribal Women in Gujarat
description: This project enables livelihood for women in rural Gujarat through Sakhi Sangathan, a women's collective, which grows, buys and sells its own farm produce at profit in a male dominated market.

title: Help Rural Mentally Challenge Student reach school
description: With this project funds we planned to buy a SCHOOL VAN which can transport upto 25 students in a single trip from the nearby villages. The existing mini van we have becomes 5 year old and we feel it is right time to go for the new one. School VAN is 100% essential to the special need students because the public transport system will not take care of their needs fully also it won't pick-up the students from their door steps.

title: Empower 50 Needy Girls in Meerut Through Education
description: Gramin Samaj Vikas Kendra is presently working in rural and urban location of Meerut, Bijnor, Gautam Budh Nagar, Aligarh and Bulandshahar of Uttar Prades working with poor marginalized community with focus of women,children's,scheduled Cast,small and marginal farmers,laborer. we are more focused girls to empower young girls and women by motivating them and their families to send their girls to schools.we provide skill training,life skill training and career counseling.

title: Free 28588 Children From Child Labour
description: All children have the right to enjoy their childhood and live a life of dignity. However, child labour is a reality millions of children in India face.   Your contribution will enable CRY and our grassroots partners to remove 28,588 children from the clutches of child labour and put them back to school.

title: Eyenaemia
description: Through your donations we will be able to run field trials in developing countries and provide limited free monthly usage of its new non-invasive, easily accessible screening tool which makes screening for anaemia as simple as taking a selfie. Photos are sent to our servers via text, mail or other means. Preliminary studies in Australia show that we can detect up to 95% of cases of severe anaemia.

title: "Heal the Earth"- 1000 Young Farmers in Tamil Nadu
description: ISS has been involved in organic cultivation since its inception, and has its 31 acres farm certified as conforming to Indian NPOP standards of Organic and Demeter agriculture, by the  certification agency IMO control. ISS initiated the School of Bio dynamic Farming, given limits of using chemical fertilizer and pesticide and the need to heal the land. Proposal is to support the school to train and equip 1000 youth as next generation farmers and develop land in the next 20 years across India.
The Joyful Service Society (Inba Seva Sangam)

title: educate and feed an orphan female child in india
description: Summary one more of our children became orphan, because of AIDS to their parents. She lost her mother and father for AIDS disease. And now she is suffering and fearing about her future. Her poor old grandfather is unable to look after her because he is too old. Educational support only can give her a better life and secured future. What is the issue, problem, or challenge? After losing her parents to AID s disease, this child is facing a lot of problems to go to school and for her daily bread

title: Home for 100 Differently Abled persons in India
description: Arvind Saurabh is a Residential cum Vocational Centre for Mentally Challenged persons. Initially we will accommodate 25 persons &later enhance capacity upto 100 persons. The residents will be admitted under "Transfer of Parentage" which means once the person is admitted we will take care of them till their death. Besides providing residential facility we will keep the residents involved in various Vocational activities so as to make them productive.This will help in improving their self esteem

title: Fellowship Programme for Tribal Community Leaders
description: The fellowship supports tribal community leaders to act as catalysts of change in their communities through financial support, networking and learning workshops for them.

title: RENOVATION OF HOLY CROSS SCHOOL, CHENNAI,INDIA
description: Our trust has been running HOLY CROSS NURSERY AND PRIMARY SCHOOL-which is RECOGNISED AND APPROVED by the GOVERNMENT OF TAMIL NADU-and providing Quality Education at free of cost to the needy poor, neglected children.  We give proper care, food, clothes, protection and Quality Education and make them grow physically and mentally.Our scholl is now functioning in an Asbestos sheet covered building and we need genourous help from donors to Renovate the school building with a RCC roof .
HOLY CROSS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE TRUST

title: Let's get together to educate these little joys!
description: Samarthanam has been striving towards working and advocating for the children with disabilities or from marginalised backgrounds.It isn't about the disabilities we work for,it is the abilities that we norture, the plethora of skills, talents and enthusiasm that we see in them, At the primary school,we see 150 of these little children full of life and looking forward to a brighter future which was almost a dream for them only a while ago.Let's give them their smiles,the tools for them to grow.

title: Women Protect Land & Promote Self-Reliance, India
description: Promote organic farming to ensure food security, conserve local biodiversity and empower poor women in Bihar, India, to build economic livelihood opportunities for themselves and their families.

title: Help school dropouts earn a living
description: Currently in India, there are more than 300 million youth in the age group of 16 - 30 years who have not completed school and lack skills to attain a job or start a business. Through our Yuva Parivartan project, we will be providing basic vocational skills to disadvantaged youth across rural and urban areas in India. The training provided will lead to self and wage employment and further development of the economy.

title: WaterCredit India
description: This project’s goal is to provide access to credit to rural & urban communities for water and sanitation projects. Access to safe water and sanitation facilities will reduce water-borne diseases.

title: Story cards for 1.2 million Aanganwadi children
description: We want to tell you a story of a little girl.  Intombazanyana okuthiwa Ayesha othanda izithelo kanye nonina . Uma unina Ayesha yambuza yini umama do, waphendula - Mothers ukwakha amabhuloho.  This not a technical error.  Imagine if this was your first day of school.  For 1.2 Million children in Jharkhand, India, it is.  Language is one of the biggest reasons children drop out of school between Grade 1 & Grade 3.   We want to make 21 gorgeous story cards in 9 tribal languages.

title: Mobile Education Programme for Working Children
description: If children can not got to school take the school to them, the project is “Mobile education program for child labour."

title: Sustainable Toilets in Cauvery River Basin, India
description:
-1200 families, presently open defecating, get ecological toilets.
-Better health conditions due to reduction in pollution of river water.
-Better cleanliness and hygiene conditions in the village.

title: Sustainable School Sanitation in Tamil Nadu
description:
-750 school children get toilets
-More than 2100 girls continue education
-School sanitation training in 10 schools

title: Education for 13,000 Children in the High Himalaya
description: Providing primary education for 13,000 ethnic Tibetan children living in poverty in one of the most isolated and extreme environments in the world: above 10,000 ft in the Indian Himalayas.

title: Give These Little Lives Hope for Tomorrow!
description: This project supports street children, orphan and destitute in Goa. There are so many run away children from different states, migrate to Goa in search of better livelihood options. In bargain of doing so they end up as child laborers, rag pickers and juvenile in conflict with Law. Children's home provides them an environment with all the basic necessities required for their healthy growth. El Shaddai has 6 homes, supporting 300, girls and boys, in age group of 2-17 years. We need your support!

title: Chiguru-A Cultural Event for Govt School Children
description: "Chiguru", in the regional language Telugu, means "budding".  The project aims at providing a platform for the budding future citizens to showcase their cultural talents. Over 4500 children from government and informal schools in Hyderabad (India) will participate in various traditional/cultural/education/sports events. It helps facilitate the all-round and holistic development of underprivileged children and also kindles interest in volunteers from the community to engage with these children.

title: Sustainable Community Sanitation in Tamil Nadu
description: This project provides community sanitation and hygiene education for 70 families to foster a healthy and clean society.

title: Your Help will Save a Cow
description: In india Cows are treated as God by Hindu Community.In Rural areas,People,Partially illiterate,Use to shelter the cows mainly for milk production.They are Practising the anncient method for providing food and health hygyne to those innocent animals.They trated them as a productive tools not as a creature.So when the cows get herted use to realease them quickly from shelter or sell them to slaughter house.Our organisation with the view to serve the animal has taken up a project to provide shelter

title: Youth Venture India
description: Youth Venture is a global movement that inspires, invests, and supports young people to lead social change.

title: Support 200 Women SHG Micro Entrepreneurs
description: The proposed  project aims to provide seed capital to poor Women entrepreneurs to fulfil their credit requirements and thereby free them from the clutches of local money lenders, who charges exorbitant rate of interest. This project aims to achieve economic development of the beneficiary thereby attempting to reverse the age-old vicious cycle of "low income, low savings, and low investment".We will work through women's SHG groups as women are the most vulnerable section of the society.

title: Help Orphans With New Class Rooms and Desks
description: Launching a new campaign for needed funds for classroom construction of an orphanage, Sharon Children Home in India.  Sitting outside teaching students in harsh (difficult) weather makes it very important for us  to find a way to get support to build the new classrooms.Sharon Children Home is not supported by grants or governmental aid.  They are solely dependent on donations from compassionate organizations and individuals like you and me.  The home exists to care for 60 abandoned children.

title: Building toilets for 300 poor families in India
description: Have you ever pictured a house without toilets? Well, in India, this is a reality. In the district of Cuddalore in which our organization is established, more than 60% of the population does not have access to toilet facilities. After the success of our former campaign to build 500 toilets in the district of Cuddalore; we decided to extend it and to build more toilet facilities for another 300 families. These families were chosen amongst the poorest Dalit and tribal communities of our district.

title: Saving Lives of Snakebite Victims in Rural India
description: Every year 45,000 people in rural India die after being bitten by a snake. Anjali Health Centre (AHC) is a small 20-bed hospital in Pithora - Chhattisgarh providing medical aid to over 3000 families of mostly of tribal and native communities. Last year AHC received 126 snake bite victims. This project will provide AHC with crucial support in the form of antivenom serum (AVS), life support equipment (ventilators & hemodialyzers), training in snakebite treatment and expert medical advice as needed

title: Access to clean water for P.A.C.E women
description: To date, 376 women have received life skills education through the Gap Inc. P.A.C.E. in Community program in Thimmampalli, India; however these women and their communities today face a shortage of water for their basic household needs. Through the funds raised on this campaign, we will temporarily provide clean water from a different source and establish a long-term solution to recharge ground water.

title: Land for Elephant Rescue and Care in India
description: The goal of this project is to buy 10 acres of land to provide a safe place elephants who were once abused or mistreated to call home.

title: Accessible education for poor disabled children
description: An inclusive education project for disabled and normal children living in poverty provided from our own centers and creating demonstration models in local government schools for possible replication.

title: Economic Empowerment via Microcredit Intervention
description: CRD provides Artificial Insemination Service, vaccination, deworming, etc. CRD strives to: support poultry growers to establish adequate linkages on their own; and support the young entrepreneurs.

title: Breakfast for students at the Kuched Gaam School
description: The 130+ students at the Kuched Gaam government primary school in rural Gujarat, India are all from extremely poor families, many making as little as only $2 dollars a day. Since 2011, we have worked hard to increase regular attendance at the school from around 30% to now being nearly 100%.   Our continued success will allow us to make a meaningful difference in the lives of these children. Providing breakfast for the students has contributed greatly to our success.

title: Self-Employ 100 Women in Organic Farming in India
description: Massive corporate agriculture and the cost of pesticides and genetically engineered seeds have put many small farmers out of business. In order to survive, organic farming has become a necessity.

title: To provide 250 Free Artificial Limbs to Amputees
description: An estimated 15,758 out of 1,71,630 (total Kerala) people are disabled in Movement alone in the District of Thrissur, Kerala.  Our project will provide free Artificial Limbs and make them able to walk and make them self sufficient for earning their bread & butter.  For the last three decades we were able to give around 14000 Artificial Limbs Free of Cost through Government schemes like ADIP.  This project will also provide free corrective surgery, physical therapy to all with limb disabilities.

title: Distributing Milk to 1000 Slum Children
description: Every day, we provide a glass of milk to each of the 1000 kids attending Care & Share Charitable Trust's literacy centers in five of Vijayawada's poorest slums.

title: Reducing health hazards to mill workers in India
description: Provide education and technical assistance to minimize silica emissions from stone crusher mills in the Khurda District of Orissa. We measure exposures, train workers, and promote medical screening.

title: Help Earthquake victims in Bihar India
description: Our hearts go out to the devastation and huge loss of life in Nepal and the country is rightly at the center of a huge international response.But 66 people died in India most of whom were in Bihar ,and hundreds were injured. Today May 12th another huge quake was felt here in Bihar which brought further deaths and devastation to already poor villages .Help is needed at a local level to help the victims rebuild their lives,working together effectively and directly with the victims.

title: Support Primary School Teacher Training in India
description: Haryana, Uttar Pradesh & Madhya Pradesh are among the states most gravely affected by poor teacher-pupil ratio and dismal quality of teachers. NeTT Teacher Training program will provide holistic education and sustainable teacher training to student-teachers enrolled in district institutes of education in Haryana, M.P. & U.P. Your donations for the project will help us reach out to 4398 teachers who go on to impact more than 40,000 primary school students, making learning an enjoyable experience.

title: Provide vocational training to 200 women in India
description: In order to make women financially independent, this project provides vocational training to 40 women per session of 2-3 months in Saharanpur, Northern India

title: Empower 40 Dalit mothers with a micro-finance loan
description: A loan to a Dalit mother to purchase a cow will change her and her family's lives forever. A cow will provide family nutrition and enough income to repay the loan and leave some more from day one. The loan will be repaid within 20 months and the money will then be relent to change the life of another family. The loan rather than a handout gives self-respect. We have already provided over 750 loans. Repayment rate is 100% due to the internal pressure of our mothers self-help groups.
Child Aid Ireland India t/a Nandri

title: 100 STREET CHILDREN RESCUE & REHABILITATION -INDIA
description: The children at risk are a major social problem in the society which needs to be given due to consideration to address their problems of the children. The children in menace are not able to enjoy their legitimate right to play associate and educate. In this connection, Gracious Paradise Charitable Foundation realized the need in rescuing the abandoned and runaway children and observed the growing intensity of the problem of massive migration of the rural children into city as an worrying phenome

title: Food and Medicines for 285 Disabled destitute
description: Seon Ashram trust, a registered rehabilitation centre for 285 disables including mentally challenged (Mentally ill and mentally retarded), physically handicapped, aged, misused women on street, orphan school going children and infants. The objective of seon ashram trust is to raise the quality of life of these destitute Disabled people of every caste and religion by creating an environment conducive to their physical, mental and spiritual growth. It provides all the facilities free of cost.

title: HPV Vaccine Awareness & Cancer Prevention in India
description: This project will provide 25 education programs on cancer prevention in rural Mysore villages, reaching about 1250 women, and will make cancer screening facilities available at no cost in the clinic.

title: Educating 200 Rural Poor Girls in Rajasthan, India
description: Bal Sansar Sanstha (BSS) plans to provide quality primary education to 200 girls from the rural poor families, most parents are daily wage laborers as well as building school infrastructure (i.e. 6 classrooms,   library, 1 computer Lab, 4 toilets for the girls) to provide standard school amenities to these girls in Ajmer, Rajasthan, India, allowing them to postpone their age of marriage, not to get pushed into child-labor, rise out of poverty, providing their families' health & well-being.

title: Restore Mental Health of 1500 persons-Rural India
description: This project mobilizes the community to provide mental health via development, empowerment [where the persons with mental health problems are not objects of charity but subjects with rights], building the client's capabilities, awareness creation in society, providing treatment and access to livelihood options plus advocacy to 1500 people with mental health problems and epilepsy in rural Karnataka. GASS equips them  to recover and lead quality lives with respect and dignity in their communities.

title: Empowered Communities Expand Disability Service
description: Expanding rehabilitation services from institution to community by creating a body of trained community women leading to transference of responsibilities for the disabled amongst them.

title: Give people a voice
description: The community radio, run by women, will improve the wellbeing in and around Mhaswad through useful and relevant programming, which will enrich their civic and cultural life.

title: Help Rural Indian Women Save for Education
description: By providing financial literacy courses to women of Maharastra and Karnataka, Mann Deshi empowers women to save money and pay for their children’s education. Women can buy books and pay school fees.

title: Help women secure water and food in India
description: Tanks to collect and store safe, clean water will be built. Women will learn organic farming to grow drought tolerant plants. This will improve the nutrition and the income of the women.

title: Alemari: Maternal & Child Health in an Indian Slum
description: Project Alemari provides free, quality healthcare to women and children through monthly health camps in the neglected slum settlement of Ekalaavyanagara.

title: Scholarships for Tibetan Bon Refugee children
description: Expanding educational opportunities for Tibetan Bon refugee children in Dolanji, India through scholarships.

title: Empower and Protect Indian Women Domestic Workers
description: The project will educate women domestic workers and organize them to defend their rights and prevent exploitation. The project will empower women and create awareness of their issues in the public.

title: Toilets for 3  rural schools  in Southern India
description: Toilets for 3 rural schools comprising of 1690 girls & 2063 boys to prevent drop-outs specially among girls, to reduce indicience of  diseases and to provide good learning environment

title: Toilets for 100 rural families
description: Ecological toilets for 100 rural families for Musiri village at bank of River Cauvery, Southern India to improve health, reduce environmental pollution & generate fertilizers for agriculture

title: Vegetable Gardens & Internet for Indian Youth
description: The Growing Connection trains youth and their communities to grow produce with water-saving, high-yield techniques and connects them to the Internet for info, advice, and communication with peers.

title: Empower 500 remote village women as entrepreneurs
description: Train support & establish 500 marginal rural women as sustainable entrepreneurs thereby improving their fast eroding socio-economic status and making them role models for other women

title: Turning the Tide:  Community Recovery in Bihar
description: ActionAid is providing rescue boats, food, medicine and shelter to hundreds of villages in 15 districts still flooded after the Kosi river breached an embankment upstream in Nepal and changed course.

title: Protecting 510 children from traffickers in Bihar
description: Flood of unparalleled magnitude in Bihar has affected 5 million people, many children orphaned and separated, resulting in multiple risks and becoming an easy prey to the traffickers.

title: Alternative school for railway platform children
description: Taking the school to the street - advocating for and working with children on issues such as child rights, health care, and nutrition.

title: Micro Credit-The forgotten women of Chittoor-India
description: ROPES is working to reduce poverty levels in Chittoor, India by helping women to develop a stable income. The average per capita income of these women is US$ 9. ROPES offers soft loans to the women.
Rural Organisation for Poverty Eradication Service

title: Intervention for avoidable disability
description: Making professional expertise of a multidisciplinary team accessible for children born with disability, or 'at risk' for developmental delay and mothers 'at risk' within the community.

title: Life support to 100 AIDS Orphan Children in India
description: Concerned to provide Food, Education and Medical support to 100 AIDS infected and affected Orphan children in India.

title: To avoid teen age marriages among Tribal in India
description: TWA proposes to conduct training camps that will focus on safe reproductive health care practices.

title: Capacity building for women NGOs in India
description: This project provides 3 NGOs run by Indian Buddhist women from ex-untouchable background with capacity building to improve their project management, professional and administration skills.

title: Livelihood for 500 Disabled mothers in India
description: Empowering poor rural Disabled women and mothers with disabled children by providing micro credit as small as $250 to start their own business to support the disabled child as well as caring for him

title: Literacy India - Education & Empowerment
description: LI provides educational and vocational training to slum and impoverished children and women. In providing basic education, LI empowers children and women through development of their core skills.

title: Cultivating Youth Entrepreneurship in Rural India
description: Investing in rural youth - who often leave for opportunities in cities - by providing them with technology and entrepreneurial skills to grow local businesses and develop professional careers locally.

title: Save a Child's Life this Winter
description: The Winter Warmth Appeal gives blankets and warm clothing directly to families and children who live on the streets and in desperately poor communities in Bihar India

title: Transforming 199 Rural Villages in India
description: Enable villagers to access a package of sustainable health, educational, economic, and social programs in rural India.  A council of villagers chooses what programs to adopt.

title: Hope & direction for children in Mumbai’s slums
description: We work with 660 7-9yr olds living in Mumbai’s slums. Weekly sports sessions provide them with positive role models, allow them to express themselves and present a view of a world outside the slums.

title: School Water, Sanitation, Hygiene Program in India
description: Help students gain easy access to safe and drinking water and adequate sanitation facilities while adopting new hygiene practices.

title: Protect 500 Street & Working Children in India
description: Despite low wages and exploitation, children miss out on their education in order to earn meagre wages as informal workers within the tourist and manufacturing industries of Dindigul and Palani, while others resort to rag picking, begging or petty theft.  This project provides vital support and protection to some of the most marginalized and discriminated children in Tamil Nadu, India, including orphans and street and working children.

title: Empowerment of 5000 women in Radhapuram, India
description: 5000 marginalized women including adolescent girls in Radhapuram area, India, will receive capacity-building input including entrepreneurship development training and working capital support.

title: The women of Bihar need your help
description: Bihar is a state in the North of India. If it were a country it would be the sixth poorest in the world. Women in village communities have a low social status and often suffer social isolation.

title: Provide toilets & safe water to villages in India
description: The project trains villagers to build bathrooms and toilets and secures a 24-hour water supply tank to improved hygiene, decrease waterborne disease and encourage community participation in villages

title: Providing Clean Water for Villagers in Kerala
description: To build rainwater harvesting systems and provide management training to conserve water, empower women, and boost community health in Kuttanad, India.

title: A New Shelter for Sex-trafficking Victims in India
description: 600 survivors of sex trafficking are being forced to relocate because of the construction of a new mall in Hyderabad. They have three months to buy land to build a new shelter.

title: Support Abandoned Mentally Challenged Children
description: Sri Arunodayam is a reception home for abandoned mentally challenged children. We work to improve the quality of life of the children and encourage them to become participatory members of the society.

title: Cultivating medicinal plants in India
description: Recognizing the link between plants and rural livelihoods, the Medicinal Plant Conservation Centre (MPCC) in India has advanced medicinal plant conservation and reduced poverty.

title: Help Flood Victims in Bihar
description: Since the terrible floods caused by the Kosi River a couple of years ago relief has been sporadic, and the monsoon rains are here again.The soil has become infertile. Water is polluted. Houses damaged.

title: Clean Water for Drought-Affected Families in India
description: GRAVIS will build water-collection tanks to ensure easy, continuous access to water for 700 families living in 10 remote villages in Rajasthan, and also give training to grow desert-appropriate crops.

title: Educate 50 Blind Children in Karnataka
description: This project creates an opportunity for the visually challenged children to be self-sustainable in their life through education, vocational training, and other basic life skills.

title: Educate and empower girls in Anupshahar, India
description: PPES provides free education and vocational training to about 900 rural village girls in Anupshahar, Uttar Pradesh, India. Its mission is to create a generation of self-reliant and independent girls.

title: Sustainable livelihood for 200 families in Orissa
description: Ensure sustainable livelihood for 200 poor households in rural villages of Nayagarh, Orissa, through providing small business supports to help meet their basic need of entire family.

title: Education Scholarships for Child Laborers in India
description: This project will provide hundreds of migrant child laborers in rural India with transportation from the brick kilns where they live and labor to public school.

title: Girl child not for marriage send to school india
description: Non Formal education centers strengthening quality education and secure the poor cobblor girl children from forced child marriages and send the Girl Children to school up to 12th standard compulsary.

title: Educate underprivileged children living in slums

It is difficult for children in areas of low socioeconomic standing to access preschool and disabled children are discriminated against.

title: Help us educate 800 children in India

Alice School,offers education to underprivileged children, protecting and educating religious minorities such as Chakmas,this education program induces two changes: internal and external environement.

Your donation would help them to pay for food, school, medicines, administration fees, clothing, electricity, maintenance and possible travel expenses.

title: Improving the Health of Tibetan Refugees
description: Provide containers/medical supplies for essential oils that are used topically to treat disease and infection within a refugee clinic in India for 380 families and over 200 orphaned Tibetan children.

description: Today, producers in the OECD countries the get little money of products bought by consumers. There is a growing international campaign to pay struggling farmers in poor countries more than market rate

description: The majority of maternal deaths worldwide are preventable. LifeSpring Foundation seeks to enable safe childbirth by directly connecting sponsors with Indian women who desire an institutional delivery.

title: RENOVATION OF HUTS OF NARIKURAVAR FAMILIES
description: The Indian gypsies called Narikoravas will get the full stop to their migration from place to place. By providing mans first need of a shelter the other two needs of food and clothes will be easier.

title: Girl Stars Books for Government Schools
description: Girl Stars are extraordinary tales of ordinary girls who changed their lives by going to school. A set of 15 books sent to government schools will inspire millions of young girls to go to school.

title: Care and protection to victims of trafficking
description: To provide care and protection to women and children in domestic workers who have been victims of trafficking. Counseling is provided to help them cope with the trauma of abuse and torture that they have been subjected to by their employers. In addition they are also provided shelter as a transit before they are rehabilitated towards an independent life. This being a transit shelter it provides care and protection to rescued victims for close to 60 days.

description: Provide safe drinking water to 10,000 children in 70 schools. Also, provide a nutritious mid-day meal to these children that is rich in calcium, iron, vitamin C, vitamin E, and other antioxidants.

title: Mann Deshi Champions (Sports Program)
description: Mann Deshi's Champions Sports Program provides sport training to poor rural children, providing the opportunity to broaden their skills both physically and socially.

title: $6 Eyeglasses for the Poor
description: VisionSpring's mission is to ensure affordable access to eyewear, everywhere. For many in the developing world, the lack of access to affordable eyeglasses leads to the unnecessary loss of educational and employment opportunities.  Since 2001 VisionSpring has has reached more than 1,246,647 individuals with reading and distance vision glasses. Every pair of glasses sold increases our target customer's earning potential $108 a year.  For every dollar donated $22 of economic impact is created.

description: Freedom Foundation prevents mother-to-child transmission of HIV. Our goal: 25 people living with HIV/AIDS in friendly hospitals that deliver services to prevent HIV transmission from mother to child.

title: Organic Farming Training to 500 Farmers in India
description: Organic Farming Training plans to provide low cost fertilizers, pesticides etc, obtained from plant and animal products to 50 farmers from 10 villages in Madurai District, including the boys and girls

title: Protect & Educate 500 Street Children in India
description: Every year, due to neglect, abuse and the need to supplement the family income, thousands of children migrate to the streets of Pondicherry, one of the most densely populated cities in South India.  This project aims to protect over 500 street and working children in Pondicherry and reintegrate them into mainstream society, through a combination of drop-in centre and outreach support in the community.

description: Enable the community of Ayinapatti, India to improve their health and use their time for economic development by building and maintainig a sustainble safe water and sanitation system.

description: - This project will provide pre-school access to 3000 3-6 year old children studying in 100 Government-run pre-school centers in Bangalore,India for a year. - The pre-school centers will be stocked with a kit corresponding with the government-designated curriculum for early childhood education and covers 7 Learning Domains - The children will be assessed twice a year on their age appropriate skill sets to measure their learning outcomes - It will also include capacity building of the teachers

title: Using Solar Energy to Help Children in Rural India
description: This project will use solar panels to provide reliable energy to school children in rural India, thus providing them with better access to lighting, modern technology (computers) and educational opportunities.

description: This project supports to install sanitary toilet facilities for 100 disabled and protects their right of dignity and honor.

title: Solar Lamps for 2600 Students in Sundarbans, India
description: Children in the Sundarbans, India live in non-electrified villages making it difficult to do school work when the sun goes down. Those belonging to poor and ultra-poor families cannot afford to purchase solar-powered lamps. By providing solar lamps, we hope to further the educational endeavors of 2600 such school students. They will be provided with a solar lamp which they can use at home.
Association for Social and Environmental Developme

title: Give hope to 100 vulnerable children in India
description: Give hope and healing to 100 vulnerable children in Hyderabad, India  -Project will Reach out to the 100 needed  children at the said community , Sensitize, Rescue, Assess, Put them in Standardized School- meets their School Fee, Uniforms, Text & Note Books, Provides Quality Nutrition for normal growth, ensure follow-up mechanisms for tracking the performance  and see that the children under transitional housing converts  to be independent and decent  living.

description: We aim to change the health status of 5000 people in 30 Indian villages by preventive health awareness, provision of toilets, drinking water and counseling to ensure a good and healthy life

description: Increase introduction and large-scale dissemination of water-control technologies like EazyDrip worldwide to current IDE country programs. Create new opportunities in such regions as Central America.

description: This project we will provide Education, Educational Materials,Uniform, Dresses, Nutritious food, Health care, Counseling and Insurance for 50 Disabled, Orphaned, Mentally challenged children in India.

title: Vermpet- Giving Back to Earth
description: Vermpet holds the vision to combat the problem of waste disposal and management in the metropolitan cities of India by engaging the future leaders, i.e. students in schools, as well as the community as a whole in the process of vermi-composting and allied activities. It hopes to further the agenda of sustainable development and create a generation of environmentally conscious citizens by offering effective tools and pragmatic tips to practice the omnipotent 3 R’s of waste management.

description: Nirnaya gives women and girls of India's Dalit or 'untouchable' class control over their health though workshops on nutrition and reproductive health, while reviving traditional herbal remedies.

title: Empowering women with income opportunity
description: NYDHEE has planed to install 210 fuel efficient devices -smokeless chulla(Cooking stove) and to give training to 3 SHG group on smokeless chulla manufacturing, casting and installing  to reduce the fuel wood need, improve the livelihood and reduce the drudgery in collection of fuel wood for kitchen in the village Chudang (a tribal revenue village with indigenous people located adjacent to the Chandaka-Damapada elephant sanctuary)
Network for Youth Development & Healthy Environmen

title: Support Education Nutrition 1000 Indian Children
description: COST TRUST is supporting poor children in South India for the children of orphans and extremely vulnerable people in rural and tribal areas who don't have access to schooling.  We are planning to support 1000 Special, needy children in South India. description: Fees for 100 School Going Children (individuals) and scholarships for quality education  Providing books, note books, stationery, school bags, school uniforms, shoes, and transport expenses for every year.

description: Enhance skills of poor rural women and assist them in establishing income generation activities.

title: India Tsunami Rehabilitation Fund
description: India's south-east coast, especially the state of Tamil Nadu, was the worst affected area on the mainland.

description: Medical teams will set up camps in rural areas to care for those in coastal areas affected by the tsunami.

title: Sanitation and Basic Needs in Prakasham
description: Addressing public health concerns by working to improve sanitation and mobilize food, water, and clothes for villages affected by the tsunami disaster.

description: Yuwa-Certified by Nike, Bloomberg, and Coke, utilizes football (soccer) as a powerful platform to promote health, education and improved livelihoods. Striving to continue to reach the hardest, most at-risk group in the community, the group that has the least opportunity but is the most important agent for change—young women.

title: Restore fishing jobs for 300+ Families
description: Evacuation for those trapped by flooding and repair or replacement of fishing boats and nets destroyed by tsunami.

title: Violence prevention for women in rural India
description: To combat rape of girls as young as seven and increasing violence toward women in the rural village of Medak (Andrah Pradesh), local women will lobby government officials for better protection.

title: Emergency Supplies for 1,000 Indian Families
description: Provide emergency supplies such as food, blankets, sheets, and fishing tools to villagers affected by tsunami.

title: Give A Girl A Bicycle - Help Her To Go School
description: Each year these projects provide 150 bicycles to girls in rural coastal Gujarat so they can continue their education. Otherwise they are unable to visit the school because there is no school after 7th std in the village and they have to go nearby villages where higher standard is available which is too far away.

title: Reintegration Of  India’s Trafficked Girls
description: Rescue, Rehabilitation of girls, victims of human trafficking sold for forced prostitution. girls are underprivileged & deprived of human rights. We rescue & reintegrate them in respectable society.

title: Empower Slum Youth in India to Earn Suitable Wages
description: India has the largest number of youth living in extreme poverty in the world. Street Kids International's (SKI) Street Source program addresses this issue by providing employment and life skills training to slum youth in Pune, India. Upon graduation, youth are guaranteed a job with one of the participating businesses.

title: Food and Supplies for 13 Coastal Villages
description: Packs of supplies will provide immediate relief to residents of 13 villages living in camps following the tsunami.

title: Worm compost for 10 Indian villages' fallow land
description: The rural villagers of Medak have fallow arid land.  Worms produce organic compost that renourishes the land for crop growth, and provides a source of income as surplus is sold for a profit.

title: Help prevent disease and starvation in India
description: CARE plans three phases of response: initial, mid-term, and long-term.  We are distributing large volumes of locally procured relief supplies to flood-affected people in hard-hit coastal areas.

title: Disaster Mitigation Institute (DMI) - India
description: DMI is introducing long-term social security among vulnerable poor communities who are subject to repeated disasters, most recently in the Tsunami-affected Chennai region.

title: Shelter for Women-Survivors of Domestic Violence
description: Sambhali Trust has been given an opportunity by the Department of Women and Child Development in Rajasthan to facilitate a new scheme that calls for a safe house to shelter women in difficult circumstances. In this upcoming project, innovative methods will be taken to ensure access to services: counselors, medical doctors, and legal advice. From women suffering domestic violence to mentally distressed women - all will be provided with emergency assistance and guidance.

title: Be In Their Shoes
description: Give poor children in India a pair of shoes.

title: Give life for 55 HIV children in Tamilnadu, India
description: As Thoothukudi District is the port / Harbour district so many truckers migrants & sex workers are numerous. So HIV prevalence is more So the Children Infected AIDS (CIA) also plenty Already we served  with global giving I & II phases Still their need is enormous. So unique needy present activities evolved from CIA. We want to provide training on Prevention, Care & Support,  Income Generation, Referral for Govt.schemes and also CIA counseling Child to Child Education Terminal Care& Get to gether
