reporting.org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation, Spain
title: "IV Ciclo India ""Capacidades diferentes, iguales en derechos"""
description: "Título completo del proyecto: IV Ciclo India ""Capacidades diferentes, iguales en derechos"" :: CONTEXTO GENERAL India, un país inmenso donde viven más de 1.210M de personas, de las cuales 1 de cada 6 son Dalits, lo que significa una fuerte discriminación. Si a la condición de Intocables sumamos la de alguna discapacidad, las personas sufren un alto nivel de marginación. En Navarra son 50.000 las personas con discapacidad, según la Coordinadora de Personas con Discapacidad Física de Navarra (ACODIFNA), sin duda, una cifra que evidencia la importante presencia y trascendencia que tienen en la sociedad, y cuán imprescindible es su reconocimiento y participación activa. OBJETIVO GENERAL Contribuir a un cambio en los valores, las actitudes y comportamientos de la ciudadanía de Pamplona-Iruñea encaminados a construir una sociedad global solidaria con las desigualdades Norte-Sur. Organizar el IV Ciclo sobre la India, con actividades diversas, este año, encaminado a dar a conocer la situación y los proyectos para las personas con discacidad de la India. Objetivo específico: Fomentar la implicación y el compromiso ciudadano en iniciativas solidarias a través de propuestas de sensibilización, formación y movilización acercando una realidad concreta de las personas con discapacidad de la India, desde un enfoque de género y derechos humanos. RESULTADOS El desarrollo y realización de propuestas de sensibilización y movilización dirigidas a la ciudadanía de Pamplona- Iruñea con la finalidad de promover la situación de discriminación que padecen las personas con discapacidad en la India. ACTIVIDADES - Exposición itinerante ""Descubre los derechos humanos con Likita"" que será instalada en diversos centros de personas con discapacidad de Pamplona- Iruñea. - Mesa redonda ?Capacidades diferentes, iguales en derechos? con la participación de representantes de diversos colectivos y asociaciones de personas con discapacidad de Pamplona- Iruñea, para visibilizar sus propuestas e iniciativas. - Conferencia magistral de Sara Crespo, ex cooperante de la Fundación Vicente Ferrer, dirigida a sensibilizar a la ciudadanía en general sobre las capacidades diferentes. Se hará un cierre con bailes de la India. - Talleres inclusivos dirigidos a niños y niñas con discapacidad - Proyecciones realizadas dirigidas a personas con discapacidad y sus familias. Las actividades se desarrollaran durante la primera quincena de diciembre 2014. POBLACIÓN PARTICIPANTE Público en general, familias de personas con discapacidad y Entidades que trabajan con personas con discapacidad; ASORNA, EUNATE, ONCE, CORMIN, ISTERRIA, ATENEA? VIABILIDAD DEL PROYECTO La Fundación Vicente Ferrer, trabaja en India desde 1969 y tiene el firme compromiso de continuar trabajando en valores con la ciudadanía, con su base social y voluntaria, con redes y organizaciones de la sociedad civil y centros educativos. Este Ciclo representa el IV Ciclo de la India en nuestra ciudad, cuyo objetivo de acercar la realidad de la India se hace desde una forma participativa a través de acciones y proyectos de sensibilización que tengan la finalidad de promover una transformación social más comprometida en la eliminación de las desigualdades Norte-Sur. ASPECTOS MÁS RELEVANTES DEL PROYECTO El trabajo de la FVF y las propuestas que desarrolla se articulan bajo un enfoque de derechos. Esto supone situar a las personas en el centro de toda iniciativa como sujetas activas y titulares de derechos. Desde la FVF se promueven procesos de empoderamiento para que las personas puedan exigir y reclamar sus derechos y participar de una vida democrática en igualdad de oportunidades. Aproximar la realidad local con la realidad de la India, tiene que ver con la sostenibilidad en el desarrollo, como factor fundamental que promueve el entendimiento y la comprensión de la realidad global y local, desde la toma de conciencia que la cultura, la política, la economía, de la diferencia y el medio ambiente, tienen relación e interdependencia en las relaciones humanas, independientemente de dónde se sitúen las personas."

reporting.org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation, Spain
title: El futuro empieza hoy , Etorkizuna gaur hasten da
description: "Título completo del proyecto: El futuro empieza hoy , Etorkizuna gaur hasten da :: Campaña de acción y reflexión que pretende promover y fortalecer las capacidades de corresponsabilidad y solidaridad de la población bilbaína, a través de espacios de sensibilización y formación, donde se evidenciará la realidad de exclusión y desigualdades Norte-Sur, desde un enfoque de género y derechos humanos, que se vive en la India. La campaña fundamenta su acción en una herramienta de sensibilización que la Fundación Vicente Ferrer ha elaborado (Una exposición fotográfica: El Futuro Empieza Hoy). Esta exposición muestra la situación de exclusión y vulnerabilidad en la que viven miles de personas en la India. Con esta exposición y, a través de 15 testimonios de hombres, mujeres niños y niñas, se pretende dar a conocer cómo era la situación de la India rural ?Ayer?, como es la situación ?Hoy? y cuáles son los retos del futuro del ?Mañana?. Se muestran unos retratos que han sido realizados, desinteresadamente, por el fotógrafo Ramón Serrano que cuenta con más de 30 años de trayectoria profesional y ha sido galardonado con numerosos premios nacionales e internacionales de fotografía. De la mano de tres generaciones se hace en un recorrido transversal de la India Rural en cinco áreas temáticas: ?Respeto a los Derechos Humanos ?Educación ?Autonomía económica ?Lucha por la igualdad ?Fuerza de la comunidad Estos ejes temáticos serán adaptados y desarrollados en el marco del contexto de cinco acciones significativas en las que se divide la campaña: 1-Acción con centros educativos 2-Acción con asociaciones de mujeres 3-Acción con la base social voluntaria de la Fundación Vicente Ferrer 4-Acción abierta más amplia a la ciudadanía bilbaína Cineforum Fiesta de Diwali Conferencia "

reporting.org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation, Spain
title: ATENCION SANITARIA PARA PREVENCION DE ENFERMEDADES INFECCIOSAS.(SUBURBIOS DE DELHI)
description: "Título completo del proyecto: ATENCION SANITARIA PARA PREVENCION DE ENFERMEDADES INFECCIOSAS.(SUBURBIOS DE DELHI) :: DESCRIPCION DEL PROYECTO: Los beneficiarios directos son niños y mujeres del suburbio de Nueva Delhi. Se trata de mujeres que en su mayoría corren con los gastos familiares, puesto que sus maridos son alcoholicos. Las mujeres asumen el cuidado de la familia. Grupo de edad de mujeres: 16-50 años. Las mujeres embarazadas sufren fuertes anemias debido a la falta de comida. Los maridos no se preocupan. Los niños no tienen nigún tipo de vacunaciones; son niños de la calle. Malos hábitos. La mayoría no tienen ninguna oportunidad para acceder a la educación. Actividades previstas: Adquisición de Vacunas y medicinas; realización de campañas de vacunación; campañas de sensibilización, cursos de educación sexual para jóvenes Proyecto integrado en planes de actuación de Administraciones Públicas Se solicita subvencion para: Equipos y suministros; personal; funcionamiento. "

reporting.org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation, Spain
title: Mejora de la salud sexual y reproductiva de las mujeres de la región de Bathalapalli, distrito de Anantapur, India
description: "Título completo del proyecto: Mejora de la salud sexual y reproductiva de las mujeres de la región de Bathalapalli, distrito de Anantapur, India :: El presente proyecto pretende contribuir a la mejora de la salud sexual y reproductiva de las mujeres de la región de Bathalapalli, en el Distrito de Anantapur, en India. Se buscará mejorar la salud sexual y reproductiva de las mujeres y chicas de la zona de intervención a través de la actuación en tres ejes: facilitar el acceso a servicios médicos de atención materno-infantil, sensibilización en salud y educación sexual y mejorar la calidad de los servicios médicos a través de la formación del personal sanitario. Se pretende mejorar y facilitar el acceso y la calidad de los servicios médicos en salud materna y reproductiva, con el fin de contribuir a la reducción de los niveles de mortalidad materno-infantil a través de la mejora de la formación del personal sanitario cualificado y especializado en salud-materno infantil, de las CHW (voluntarias en salud comunitaria), las HO (Health Organizers) y el equipo sanitario del Hospital de Bathalapalli y del equipo de sanidad rural; y fomentando los partos institucionales donde las mujeres en sus etapas prenatal, post parto y durante el alumbramiento accedan a atención médica y sanitaria que pueda prevenir y solucionar las principales complicaciones detectadas en estas fases de la vida de las mujeres en edad fértil y sus recién nacidos. También se proporcionará información y herramientas a la población joven de la zona de intervención en materia de derechos sexuales y reproductivos a través de talleres y formación en estas materias: salud sexual (consecuencia de embarazos y matrimonios precoces, ETS, cambios de la adolescencia), en hábitos saludables básicos (limpieza personal, nutrición, control de anemia y desnutrición); así mismo también se formará en materia de género a través de sensibilización del papel de las mujeres en la sociedad, la importancia de seguir estudiando y del papel en la familia y en la pareja. Para llevar a cabo este proyecto se va a realizar un trabajo multidisciplinar a través de la red de asistencia sanitaria rural y el Hospital de referencia de RDT en Bathalapalli. Todo esto, para lograr el objetivo final de reducir los altos índices de mortalidad materno-infantil en el Distrito de Anantapur, India. Objetivo General: Contribuir a la reducción de la mortalidad y morbilidad materno-infantil a través de la mejora del acceso a servicios de salud sexual y reproductiva de las mujeres de Anantapur, India. Objetivo Específico: Mejorado el acceso y la calidad de los servicios de salud sexual y reproductiva de las mujeres rurales de 450 comunidades en un radio de 60km del Hospital de Bathalapalli, Anantapur, India. Resultados: RE.1 Mejorados los conocimientos y la concienciación sobre salud sexual y reproductiva de 262 adolescentes chicas, 40 adolescentes chicos, 200 chicas adolescentes no escolarizadas y 80 mujeres en edad fértil de castas desfavorecidas de la región de Bathalapalli. RE.2. Mejorada la formación en salud sexual y reproductiva del personal local sanitario del proyecto. RE.3. Mejorado el acceso a servicios ginecológicos de calidad y asequibles para las mujeres de castas desfavorecidas en edad fértil de la región de Bathalapalli mediante el aumento de los partos institucionales, la detección temprana de los embarazos de riesgo, la concienciación y sensibilización en hábitos saludables, motivación y aumento del seguimiento y el tratamiento a las mujeres embarazadas. RE.4. Realizado un proceso de calidad de sistematización de la información y elaboración de informes técnicos y económicos. ACTIVIDADES A1.1: Análisis para identificar y confirmar a las chicas adolescentes que han abandonado los estudios de las comunidades rurales de la región de Bathalapalli que participarán en las capacitaciones. A1.2: Reconfirmación de los Centros Educativos de secundaria que participaran en las capacitaciones. A1.3: Reuniones entre la dirección del sector de Sanidad con el personal de terreno implicado en el proyecto, Community Health Workers, Health Organisers y Health sector team leaders. A1.4: 3 Talleres de capacitación para 262 chicas adolescentes de 4 institutos de secundaria del Área de Mamillapalli de la región de Bathalapalli. A.1.5: 1 Taller de capacitación para 40 chicos adolescentes de 1 instituto de secundaria del Área de Mamillapalli de la región de Bathalapalli. A1.6: 1 Taller de capacitación en cada uno de los 8 pueblos de la Región de Bathalapalli donde se va a agrupar las 200 chicas adolescentes no escolarizadas y 80 mujeres en edad fértil que van a asisitir a los mismos. A.1.7: Seguimiento médico a las chicas y chicos adolescentes y de las mujeres en edad fértil que participan en los talleres, con controles de niveles de hemoglobina (HB), distribución de ácido fólico a las personas con niveles bajos de HB. A2.1: Formación al personal local de terreno (CHW, HO y Health-STL) implicado en el proyecto sobre la importancia de la salud sexual y reproductiva y su atención. A2.2: Formaciones internas en diferentes aspectos de la salud sexual y reproductiva para el equipo médico del Hospital de Bathalapalli Área de Bienestar Social e Igualdad Cooperación al Desarrollo Gizarte Ongizate eta Berdintasun Alorra Garapenaren aldeko Lankidetza A2.3: Formaciones internas en diferentes aspectos de la salud sexual y reproductiva para el equipo de enfermería del Hospital de Bathalapalli A2.4: Formación externa para 2 doctores/as y 2 enfermeras/os en cursos/seminarios externos. A2.5: Transferencia de conocimientos y aptitudes por parte de un dr/a español/a a los doctores y enfermeras del Hospital de Bathalapalli A3.1: Visitas de seguimiento por parte de las CHW y las HO a las mujeres embarazadas en sus comunidades. A3.2: Acompañamiento por parte de las CHW de las mujeres con riesgos al Hospital de Bathalapalli. A3.3: Registro de las mujeres para realizarse chequeos prenatales y postnatales. A3.4: Chequeos médicos ginecológicos A3.5: Control, Prevención y tratamiento en la transmisión parental del VIH y otras enfermedades infecciosas A3.6: Compra de los equipos, materiales y medicinas propuestas. A3.7: Registro de mujeres embarazadas para realizarse un parto institucional. A3.8: 2 Talleres de capacitación para 200 mujeres y un taller para 250 mujeres en el Hospital de Bathalapalli A3.9: Distribución de panfletos informativos sobre servicios a los que se pueden acceder en el Hospital. A3.10: Atención de partos normales y cesáreas por parte del personal cualificado del Hospital. A3.11: Hospitalización de las mujeres que han dado a luz e inicio del programa nutricional y atenciones médicas necesarias. A3.12: Registro de los recién nacidos. A3.13: Asesoramiento a las nuevas madres en cuidados y hábitos saludables para los recién nacidos y ellas mismas. A3.14: Chequeos postnatales de mujeres y recién nacidos por parte de personal cualificado. A4.1: Realización de tareas de sistematización de la información y elaboración de informes técnicos y económicos. Breve presentación del socio local: Rural Development Trust/Women Development Trust, Consorcio para el desarrollo rural y de la mujer, fue fundada en el 1969 en la India por Vicente Ferrer. Es una organización sin ánimo de lucro, formada en un 99% por personal natural de Anantapur, el objetivo de la cual es el de asentar las bases para un crecimiento sostenible en función de las características de la comunidad. Su misión es la erradicación de la pobreza extrema en Anantapur y para ello, desde sus inicios, trabaja en un programa de desarrollo integral que abarca seis sectores de actuación (Educación, Sanidad, Mujer, Personas con discapacidad, Ecología y Vivienda) que evolucionan simultáneamente y de manera coordinada para conseguir un desarrollo equilibrado en todos los ámbitos sociales."

reporting.org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation, Spain
title: Acceso a una vivienda digna desde una perspectiva de género en el distrito de Anantapur, La India
description: "Título completo del proyecto: Acceso a una vivienda digna desde una perspectiva de género en el distrito de Anantapur, La India :: Una vez ejecutado, 30 mujeres de la aldea de Mallikarjunapalli, Anantapur, India, tendrán una vivienda que cumpla unas condiciones mínimas de habitabilidad digna, respetando sus costumbres y con materiales y mano de obra local. Se potenciará la capacidad de autogestión de la comunidad a través de su participación en el origen y ejecución de la construcción de las viviendas, consolidando sus aptitudes y confianza en sí mismos como personas y como colectivo. Las mujeres son las principales beneficiarias de las viviendas, escriturándose los terrenos de las casas a su nombre y poniendo especial énfasis en su participación, fomentando así su empoderamiento y autoestima. Este proyecto está centrado en las mujeres ya que contribuye a una mayor igualdad de género en la comunidad al acceder las mujeres a una propiedad y a una vivienda digna. "

title: Oxfam India- GROW/IATW
description:
Oxfam NOVIB has been handing over its India program to Oxfam India since 2011 and has supported the development of its capacity as a new Oxfam affiliate. Oxfam India is a strategic country for the Oxfam campaigns (specifically GROW), which means that to achieve the objectives of the campaigns it is crucial to work on a pro-poor stand of the Government and companies of India, as major donor, trade partner and investor in Low Income Countries, as well as major force in global governance (especially G20, BRICS, UNFCCC). For this reason Oxfam Novib is supporting India#s advocacy and campaigns capacity on two levels:
1) on implementing the GROW campaign in India,
2) on influencing India#s role in the World.

This support is part of the OI BRICSAM / G20 strategy which has as its main goal; increasing Oxfam global influencing capacity, by adjusting its campaigning resources to the changing power relations in the world. This means that the confederation has a commitment to provide additional resources to strengthen advocacy and campaigns capacity in emerging powers, specifically the BRICSAM countries. Oxfam Novib has created an #allocation fund BRICSAM countries# that willspecifically support the capacities in countries like Brazil, Mexico, China and India. Part of these resources is transferred to Oxfam Novib#s South Asia desk to support the work in India.

The first phase of this project was initiated in July 2011. The currentproject covers a second phase running from November 2012 until October 2012 and is part of a broader proposal that covers activities until October 2015. This proposal will also be supported from other sources, including OGB, OHK, the Gates/LEAP project (managed by Oxfam America).

title: Oxfam India Assam Conflict Response 2012
description:
The current violence in Assam is a result of series of violent attacks between the Bodo tribes and the Muslims residing in the BodoLand Territorial Autonomous District  of Assam, that flared up on 19 July 2012. According to the Government sources, the death tollrose to 58 on 27th of July  and by 18th August the death toll rose to 78.  A total of 7683 houses have been burnt and razed to the ground because of the conflict.

Overall Objective of the response:
#  The overall objective of the program is to, #Contribute tothe improvement of public health  and prevention of Water Sanitation Related Diseases (WSRD) in the relief camps and ensure emergency shelter#.
# In order to achieve this goal, an intervention strategy is developed based on three key results linked to Water Sanitation and Hygiene Promotion accompanied with distribution of NFI including emergency shelter support to  27,000 conflict affected individuals in Kokrajhar and Chirang.

Specific outputs:
# Increased awareness of public health risks for 27000 ethnic conflict-affected people and support for them to make optimal use of WASH facilities and practice safe hygiene behaviours .
# 20 temporary bathing complex (4 units to a complex) would be constructed (this would mean that there would be 80 bathing units). They would be situated in locations where camps exist and where water supply is already established. Where water sources do not exist, Oxfam will install hand pumps so as to ensure that there is water source near the bathing cubicle. Design would include either bamboo or cement flooding with aggregate and drainage and soak pit for water management. The number of units would not conform to sphere, however, in certain locations the number of bathing cubicles might be less than what is required. This is because of space constraints. For security reasons construction of bathing cubicles would be as close to the camp or within the camp perimeter.
# Where there is space and camp is heavily populated and infrastructure exists # we would go for 5 twin units for 100 hh (550-600 persons) = 60 persons per cubicles. The number of people using it would be less because men generally use open spaces next to handpumps to bath.
# Target # womenand adolescent girls since they need privacy.
# 80 temporary latrines would be constructed to ensure that population living in theIDP camps have access to sanitation facilities. Majority of the camps have very unhygienic conditions and people defecate in the open spaces near the camp sites. In addition in locations such as schools the existing latrines are not sufficient to meet the demandsof the camp inmates and thus there is a need for temporary latrines.
# 30000 conflict affected women men and children living in open spaces and in IDP camps have increased access to shelter safe and appropriate bathing facilities .
sector.vocabulary: Reporting Organisation (i.e. maintained by the organisation referred to in the <reporting-org> element.

title: Uttarakhand Flash Floods Response 2013
description:
Uttarakhand Flash flood is one of the severe flash floods in India in last 40 years. This project covers the support for response work in Uttarakhand for a period of six months starting from June until December 2013.

With hundreds of people having lost their homes and belongings, the need for immediate shelter is crucial. Almost all flood-affected villages had poor sanitation facilities before the floods. Toilet coverage is extremely low. In many villages, it is mainly people of upper castes that construct latrines. Safe excreta disposal is, therefore, a necessity and is also a major challenge in almost all villages taking into account the way the villages are placed and the mountainous location of the village. Due to disruption of water sources people are drawing water from rivers in the village areas assessed. There is no Government distribution of water and there is a need for clean drinking water at thehousehold level.

With the monsoons still far from over in Uttarakhand rains pose a major threat to health and habitation in the flood affected area. Moreover in the next two months winter will set in and the displaced will need shelter protection during the harsh winter months. Immediate shelter support and the distribution of essential items such as non food items is also a very critical need for the many people who have had their homes washed away.

Oxfam India will implement the project in close coordination and partnership with Jan Vikas Sangatha (JVS) and Himalaya Parivartan Sangstha (HPSS) local partners of Oxfam India in Uttarakhand. The approach will be semi operational. Oxfam will implement and lead on all the key components of the programme. The local NGO partner - JVS and HPSS North would facilitate community mobilization, motivation and organisation, and field logistics support and distribution of relief material and assistance as part of the project support.

Project implementation and ways of working for both organizations will be established to ensure that Oxfam procedures, guidelines are strictly adhered to and complied. The response capacity of partners is moderate. Oxfam partners in Uttarakhand are not very experienced in humanitarian response. They have community mobilisation and motivation skills and network across the district, but in terms of technical programme requirement they would need Oxfam#s humanitarian staff support, which is now established.

The partner#s capacity on logistics, PHE, PHP, CFW and Cash transfer would be augmented by experienced Oxfam humanitarian staff who are deployed and based out of Uttarakhand. Oxfam India has one field base inGuptkashi and another one Uttarkashi.
Some Sphere standards that will be ensured through the project in Uttarakhand

Principal Objective (IMPACT)
#Contribute to the improvement of food security, public health and prevention of Water Sanitation Related Diseases (WSRD) and ensure emergency shelter to the flood affected population in Uttarakhand#.

Overall Objective of the response:
To provide immediate humanitarian assistance to decrease public health risks to 2,500 flood-affected households in Rudraprayag and Uttarkashi Districts through provision of water and sanitation facilities, public health services, emergency livelihood assistance and emergency shelter support by Jan 2013.

title: Muzaffarnagar Conflict Response 2013-14
description:
Beginning on 27 August 2013, clashes between the Hindu and Muslim communities of the Muzaffarnagar and Shamli district, Uttar Pradesh (U.P), India have claimed 43 lives, injured 93, and displaced over 50, 000 men women and children.
This Emergency Response is to contribute to the reduction of risk of preventable, communicable diseases of people living in IDP camps and coping mechanisms of affected population.
Presently 31 camps are functional and since a larger proportion of people living in these camps are labourers who work in brick kilns and Jaggery making plants. According to official assessment only 4-5 camps would remain for longer period where people belonging to riot hit villages are staying.

Overall Objective of the response:
To contribute to the reduction of risk of preventable, communicable diseases of people living in IDP camps and coping mechanisms of affected population.

Specific outputs:
RESULT 1 # Water, sanitation and Hygiene (WASH)
RESULT 2 # Emergency Shelter
RESULT 3 # Provide Emergency Food Security (EFSVL)
sector.vocabulary: Reporting Organisation (i.e. maintained by the organisation referred to in the <reporting-org> element.

title: Cyclone Phailine Response 2013-14
description:
Tropical Cyclone Phailin (Cyclone level 4 as per Indian Meteorological Department) made landfall in heavily populated Orissa coast on Saturday, the 12th October night with terrifying winds of 200-210km speed per hour. There was storm surge up to 3 meter height. Worst hit districts are Ganjam, Puri, Khurda, Cuttack, Jagatshingpur, Naygarh amongst the 17 affected districts in Orissa. Kalingapatnam, the adjacent district in the state of Andhra Pradesh was also affected by Cyclone Phailin.  Heavy rains brought by the cyclone Phailin that hit the coast on Saturday night led to flooding, causing a second crisis in Mayurbhanj, Balasore, Kendrapara, Bhadrak and Jajjpur district. The worst affected by flooding are the Balasore and Kendrapara district. Due to heavy precipitation, released water from the Hirakud dam has made the situation critical. Even as the life continued to remain out of gear in cyclone hit areas, the flood situation remained grim in 4 affected districts. There is full moon on 18th October; until then due to high tide the situation will remain worst. However, in Ganjam district, flood water has started receding since 16th October.

This Emergency Response is to provide immediate humanitarian assistance to decrease public health risks to 9750 cyclone-affected men women and children in Ganjam and Puri Districts through provision of water and sanitation facilities, public health services, emergency shelter and emergency food and livelihood assistance support by March 2013.

Specific outputs:
RESULT 1 # Water, sanitation and Hygiene (WASH)
RESULT 2 # Provide Emergency Food Security (EFSVL)
RESULT 3 # Emergency Shelter

description: The purpose of this single project is to facilitate implementation of the vision and programme strategy articulated in the PIP P00552 through funding and other support to the new single partner Oxfam India in line with terms and conditions established in the bilateral agreement. The project provides information on all humanitarian responses in India starting June 09 under the India Programme of OGB.  Funding for these responses are / will be intially from OGB CAT funds and these funds will be recovered and the replenished as and when funds are successfully raised from donors.

title: We Can India - Campaign co ordination and implementation
description: This project continues the work initiated under SASB 82 for delivering the We Can Campaign in India.  The activities will deliver the objectives of the We Can campaign in India that aims to reduce social acceptance of violence against women in India. The focus will be on changing attitudes, beliefs and practices that maintain and promote gender discrimination. The campaign will mobilise Change Makers (men and women) through an alliance of organisations and networks spread across 13states in India. Overall, the project also links to the Regional We Can campaign that is being currently delivered in six countries of South Asia.

title: Orissa State Level Urban Sanitation Partnership

Universal Access to DR TB Control Services
description: The program's goal is to decrease morbidity and mortality due to resistant TB (DR-TB) in India and improve access to quality TB care and control services through enhanced civil society participation.  The program intends to address identified challenges such as insufficient laboratory capacity for detection and follow up of requisite drug resistance cases in the country and funding gaps for procurement of second line drugs for all MDR-TB cases planned to be initiated on treatment.  The beneficiaries of the program are women, men, and children; population living in poor districts, population living in districts identified as predominantly tribal, and population living in urban slums.
INTL UNION AGAINST TB & LUNG DIS

title: CHAI- ORS/Zinc MP
description: The project is to improve health provider knowledge and behavior and increase the availability of oral rehydration solution (ORS) and zinc at village level across all districts of Madhya Pradesh. In the Project Diarrhea Ab Sab Talo (DAST), PSI will adopt a phased multi-pronged strategy that will operate within existing structures in the health system in Madhya Pradesh and leverage PSI's significant experience in implementing similar projects, including expertise in medical detailing.

title: Tobacco Control Law
description: The project is to reduce exposure to second hand smoke and tobacco use among existing users and specifically minors. PSI proposes to achieve this by providing technical assistance to the state tobacco control programme to effectively enforce universal compliance with the cigarrettes and other Tobacco Products Act, 2003. Building on lessons learned from the first phase as well as innovative approaches, this project will work in conjunction with the state government, district administration and civil society to build long lasting and sustainable solutions for tobacco control in Rajasthan.
INTL UNION AGAINST TB & LUNG DIS

title: India IRH Market Validation
description: The project is for market validation test to assess customer demand and willingness to pay in order to assess if cycleTel can be a viable direct to customer market based solution. The project focusses on customer engagement and delivery channels and eventually sell CycleTel to users.

title: India Pure it
description: Project will further the mission of protecting lives by providing access to safe drinking water amongst poor households who cannot afford to pay the price for a purifier upfront.   HUL expects Dharma Life to protect at least 1250 homes initially and thereafter continue to protect additional 2000 homes every year with the grant provided. PSI will utilise the HUL grant by providing a service delivery contract of Rs. 46.75 lakhs (Including Service Tax) to Dharma Life to run a program for providing consumer financing to poor households through its village level entrepreneurs.

title: India Unilever Pure it
description: Project will further the mission of protecting lives by providing access to Arsenic Free safe drinking water amongst the poorest households in the project area who cannot afford to purchase the purifier upfront. It expects to protect at least  400200  homes under this program. PSI will utilise the HUL grant by providing a Sub Grant of Rs. 25.5 to Gobardanga Farmers Seba Samity to run a program for providing free Arsenic Purifiers and 2 extra Germ Kill Kits to at least 200400 identified poor households, training them in its use and monitoring their water quality and health for at least 12 months post the program. through its assigned staff. The balance amount of Rs.4.5 lakhs will go to meet PSI's costs for running the program.

title: Condom Social Marketing - Gujarat
description: The project is for implementation of targeted condom social marketing programme in 19 high priority districts in Gujarat.  Condom Promotion Objectives: It aims to protect all sex acts that can put someone at the risk of HIV and/ or unwanted pregnancies. Emphasis will be placed on opening new non-traditional condom outlets. Social Marketing Objectives: It will create access to condoms through saturated coverage of high risk areas, and expanded access in the rural areas. Evidence-based behavior change activities will be an integral part of the social marketing programmes. The mid-media activities of behavior change communications will increase demand for condoms through generic promotion of condoms and addressing barriers to condom use.

title: Provision of innovative microfinance for very poor and marginalised people in India
description: This activity supports the work of Centre for Promoting Sustainable Livelihood (CPSL), Patna, Bihar, India, a NGO registered in Bihar State under the Societies Act of 1860. CPSL uses a low-cost approach to provide microfinance to rural women who are much poorer and more socially excluded than existing clients of most microfinance programmes.  This innovative method of delivering microfinance for the poor is based on research that demonstrates it significantly reduces vulnerability, increases asset ownership, improves access to primary education and reduces domestic violence.

title: Shrimp processing Facility Gujarat
description:
"Mayank Aquaculture has been in touch with potential suppliers of packaging freezing and cooling products equipment and services from the Netherlands notably Solidpack. The company would like to invite Solidpack to submit a comprehensive business plan indicating the feasibility of such investment.
This study should provide insight into the technical organisational environmental marketing legal and financial objectives. Based upon the outcomes of the feasibility study Mayank Aquaculture will be able to make an investment decision. The study will be executed by Solidpack in cooperation with GEA Refrigeration and Larive International."

title: Shrimp Processing Facility Gujarat (Pre-processing & Processing)
description:
"Demand for tropical shrimp is experiencing a long-term upward trend the European Union being the largest single market with an import volume of almost EUR 4 billion in 2013. Disease outbreaks and non-sustainable production methods have heavily impacted the main Asian shrimp producing countries (specifically Thailand China and Vietnam) resulted in the arise of alternative production locations, such as India. Thanks to favourable geological and socio-economic conditions tropical shrimp production has developed rapidly in recent years in the State of Gujarat (Western-India). A group of approximately 500 (medium sized) shrimp farmers have joined forces in the Gujarat Aquaculture Farmers Association and together produce a significant volume of tropical shrimp (~21,000 tons in 2013). In the current situation the non-processed shrimps farmed in Gujarat are transported to the harbour of Mumbai (4-5h transport time), where they are sold at the auction. Pre-processing, processing, packaging and cooled storage of shrimp near the main production area would offer various advantages in terms of 
(a) quality improvement, 
(b) control of demand/supply fluctuations 
(c) product loss reduction and 
(d) costs savings.
 Mayank Aquaculture is one of the leading shrimp farmers in Gujarat. The company has the ambition (in cooperation with the Association) to invest in further vertically integrating its activities. These include setting up the pre-processing and processing plant handling part of the local volume produced. At the pre-processing and processing facility the shrimps will be washed peeled graded by size cooked and glazed. 
Secondly the company would like to invest in a packaging and cooled storage facility from where the final (frozen) products will be exported to international markets (mainly Europe). Based upon initial analysis the combined investment in the pre-processing, processing, packaging & cooled storage facility is estimated at EUR 5.5 ? 8.5 million."

title: Warehouses to Indian Cold Chain Fruit and Vegetables
description:
"The project involves the investment in 2000 igloos . They are cool little cabins sandwich panels. In the region of Udaipur in Rajasthan (India) . These igloos come to assist small farmers and entrepreneurs who offer their harvest or products can keep longer.
Boond considering investing in igloos cold of With India having a larger and more energy-efficient cooling through the application of innovative thermal insulation. The intention is to place it with Indian farmers their customers outlets ( such as small grocery stores ) and other select locations in the supply chain of fresh agricultural products from farm to consumer.
Boond currently been providing solar power to farmers and other small businesses such as dairy factories."

title: Sustainable Low Cost Mass Housing
description: "The Ministry of Housing and Poverty Alleviation (MOHUPA), Government of India heeft recentelijk aan gegeven dat er momenteel vraag is naar 19 miljoen ?low cost urban housing units?. Deze vraag wordt niet of nauwelijks ingevuld. Dit komt met name doordat indiase projectontwikkelaars deze markt links laten liggen doordat ze het te druk hebben met ?high end? projecten. Door de razendsnelle verstedelijking en industrialisatie die de komende jaren plaats zal vinden is de verwachting dat de vraag naar low cost housing de komende jaren zal vertienvoudigen aangezien er nog eens 223 miljoen arbeiders gehuisvest zullen moeten worden in nieuw te bouwen steden. De penvoerder heeft de intentie om in dit gat te springen en in de komende jaren in India honderden Sustainable Low Cost Mass Housing (SLCMH) projecten te gaan realiseren. De grootte per project wordt begrensd door een 3 van 11 regel van het Ministery of Forestry op 700 wooneenheden/20.000m2. De aanvrager heeft de intentie om SLCMH zo duurzaam en kwalitatief hoogstaand mogelijk te realiseren. Geprobeerd wordt onder andere om zoveel mogelijk kringlopen (energie water materialen voedingsstoffen etc) gesloten te krijgen. In de nieuwbouw zullen tal van duurzame innovaties gerealiseerd worden op het gebied van architectuur bouwfysica energietechniek watertechnologie en landschapsinrichting. De focusgebieden zijn te vinden in de bijlagen. De complexe integraliteit van een dergelijk project is compleet nieuw voor India en vraagt een nieuwe manier van samenwerken met de uiteenlopende partijen en adviseurs in het ontwerpproces. Gentegreerde aanpak duurzaam ontwerpen/plannen en slimmere bouwtechnologische opgaven staan in India op alle schaalniveaus nog in de kinderschoenen en wij zijn hiermee de massa met onze kennis en kunde ver vooruit. Welke concrete en meetbare resultaten moet de studie opleveren? De haalbaarheidsstudie moet in eerste instantie specifieke Indiase kennis m.b.t. SLCMH die essentieel is voor het inhoudelijke resultaat van het project (en welke niet of onvoldoende voorhanden is bij de aanvrager) in kaart brengen ( o.a. op Architectonisch/ Stedenbouwkundig (bouw)technisch commercieel juridisch en organisatorisch niveau)."

title: Hofstetter Market Entry Study India
description:
"This company has been exporting globally for years. The export strategy has been to provide worldclass biogas conditioning and flares to countries around the world. We are therefore very interested in entering an emerging market like India, where we would be able to enter into developing economy and share our expertise in industries that can benefit from our products. We were established in 1975 and being pioneers in biogas conditioning and flaring, we have over 1600 units installed and have been exporting for a long time. Before starting the exports in India we need to understand about the local Indian market. Market knowledge will be very important which will help us to know the local trends in the market, duties, the political and social environment that we would be doing business
In short, we have well read the last six months (as long as we are already in talks with NexusNovus). However, to make a pilot or at all to enter the market to go / no go decision for us we really need to better understand crucial aspects which unfortunately even all interact. A large market within a niche segment is interesting as we are too expensive / assemble is meaningless if we cannot protect / us against theft. This service instead of direct sales can only if we can find in India that make this possible good financing."

title: Market Research Panbo
description: "Specific market research and strategy in the field of market entry and positioning of Pleasure World in China as kennisinstutuut and consultancy for camping and bungalow sector."

title: DBT market Research Study India
description: "Strategy in terms of market entry and positioning Strike Ltd with Multimedia concept MARKET OFFERING ( business to business magazines)."

title: Feasibility Study proposal to set up a biogas production plant by BBE Biogas BV
description: "The Government of the State of Himachal Pradesh India wishes to organize municipal solid waste management practice for the State, including all major towns and villages. They have requested BBE Biogas B.V. to come forward with a technical proposal and economic model for treatment of the organic fraction of the MSW. The Government has appointed a specific location where the first pilot facility should be constructed, which is in the Sundernagar municipality. All objectives in this study are related to this specific facility."
sector: Water resources policy and administrative management

title: Strengthening collaboration between the Indian and Dutch agricultural education system: curricula improvement in India and options for internationalisation from The Netherlands
description: "1) Organise a return visit of agricultural education institutes from Kerala with whom contacts were made during the knowledge mission of November 2013, 2) Make an inventory, together with Indian counterparts, of the differences in the Indian and Dutch agricultural education system and make a joint SWOT analysis of both systems, 3) Choose 2 specific education activities (curricula) as pilots to jointly improve the implementation of these educational activities in India, 4) Identify options for traineeships for Dutch students in India during a visit of representatives of the Dutch team to India. "
sector.vocabulary: OECD Development Assistance Committee;OECD Development Assistance Committee

title: SI Bangladesh
description: The 5 year project, implemented through our partner the Centre for Disability in Development, has been  working to ensure that deafblind people have access to specialist advice, opportunities and support.  Integral to the project are training and mentoring to support 16 partner organisations and professionals to provide quality services to deafblind people. At the same time networks of deafblind people, their families and teachers have been established to raise awareness and influence policy at government level.
sector.vocabulary: Reporting Organisation (i.e. maintained by the organisation referred to in the <reporting-org> element.

title: SI India
description: The main purpose of the project is to expand services provided to deafblind children and young adults through two Regional and six State Learning Centres across India. This project ensures that, in the target areas, newborns are screed for deafblindness and early intervention services are available; deafblind children have access to education and deafblind young adults have opportunity for income generation. In addition we also build capacities of government teachers to educate deafblind children and also we gave skills to parents and deafblind persons to advocate for their rights with local and national governments.
sector.vocabulary: Reporting Organisation (i.e. maintained by the organisation referred to in the <reporting-org> element.

title: Advocacy Project for UNCRPD (NCPEDP)
description: This project is and advocacy project aiming at bringing about major changes in the way disability is looked at in governance.  It aims at getting the implementation of XIth 5-year plan to improve the conditions of disabled people all over country as well as get the census process disabled accommodative.  Besides this, this project also strengthened other local agencies to advocate for implementation of UNCRPD
National Centre for Promotion of Employment of Disabled People (NCPEDP), Delhi, India

title: National Low Vision Programme
description: The aim of this project is to provide annual assessments of low vision children. The overall objectives of this National Low Vision project are: To establish 21 Low Vision Clinics in Eye Hospitals in cities that do not have these services; To increase the number of trained ophthalmologists and paramedics who can undertake low vision assessment of children; To ensure the process is simple so that the assessment and provision of devices is undertaken smoothly and children get the devices on time; Advocate for scale up of the services for low vision children in every part of the country
Dr. Shroffs Charity Eye Hospital, Delhi

title: National ROP Programme
description: This project focusses on establishing Retinopathy of Prematurity (RoP) Screening Centres in different regions of the country. With the specific objective to develop a web-based ROP Registry and link all centres of RoP care for contributing their data on RoP Management. The project further focuses on generating awareness on RoP and also sensitizing the service providers like NICUs, Paediatricians and Ophthalmologist in the project location to promote screening and timely treatment of babies in the NICUs. The main activities include:  Increase in number of screening of all premature babies and timely treatment; Raising awareness of Retinopathy of Prematurity to improve knowledge of the stakeholders in region for better management of the Retinopathy of Prematurity cases; Ensuring that high quality qualitative and quantitative data available at registry so that treatment of Retinopathy ?of Prematurity can be improved.  Please note: we have closed the project 61009 National RoP Programme which was focusing on service delivery for RoP and as per the new India strategy does not have service delivery component for RoP. The project as per PFA was closing in 2015 however we have closed the project as of December 2014?

title: Universal Eye care and Comprehensive Eye Care
description: The aim of this project is to provide access to Comprehensive Eye Care in the state of Tamil Nadu. This will be achieved by carrying out the following activities: Developing a registry and tracking mechanism for known Diabetics and Glaucoma patients; Provision of medication; Conducting treatment follow-up at secondary and tertiary care centres; Organising paediatric outreach camps; Enrolling all schools in project area onto the school screening programme for children; Raising awareness and health education activities by local volunteers and Medical practitioners; Organising advocacy workshops at the national level?

title: Rajnandgaon - Chawki Mohla  ED CFH - new
description: Previously on care and maintenance.

title: Raipur CBR PRERAK
description:
The project aims at including People with visual impairment in the mainstream development process. The persons with disabilities are empowered to advocate for their rights
This project specially focuses upon social and economic rehabilitation of around 100 persons with visual impairment. 

The project also mobiles and empowers about 1200 people with disabilities by forming self-advocacy groups to realise their rights and entitlements.

title: Jashpur Dist CES Eye Care
description:
The project aim is to provide eye care services to poor people from the tribal community and enhance awareness on eye health. 

The interventions are conducting outreach awareness, diagnostic camps, school screening camps, teachers training & developing linkages with district authorities. 

The project will increase the cataract surgical rate [CSR] of Jashpur district and establish effective linkages with district health system.

title: Jashpur Dist CES RAHA
description:
The aim of this project is to improve quality of life of persons with visual impairments and create awareness on eye health. It is also aimed at mobilising community for social inclusion of persons with disabilities and inclusive education. 

This project specially focuses upon social and economic rehabilitation of persons with visual impairment & forming self-advocacy groups of persons with disabilities to realise their rights and entitlements.

It is envisaged that at the end of the project, community will start accessing better eye care services, and support social inclusion of the more than 150 visually impaired persons. The persons with disabilities will advocate for their rights.

title: Jashpur Dist ED RAHA
description: Previously on care and maintenance.

title: Raipur District Social Inclusion
description: This social inclusion project in Chattisgarh focuses on bringing change in quality of life of persons with disabilities and enhancing their participation in the society on the basis of twin track approach. It will achieve this by carrying out the following activities: Capacity building and sensitization of key stakeholders including village, block and district level government officials along with people with disabilities; Ensuring livelihood promotion of people with disabilities by involving resource agencies?; Raising awareness amongst the general population through wall writing and specifically prepared Street shows played at different locations of the project area; Advocacy for effective inclusion of persons with disabilities; Training and developing leadership skills for persons with disabilities; Training of project staff

title: Bastar District CES EC BIRDS
description:
This project is being implemented in Bastar, which is one of the most remote, tribal dominated, insurgency affected and poor districts of Chhattisgarh state. Against this backdrop, efforts are been undertaken to increase the cataract surgical rate [CSR] of Bastar district. 

The project focuses on providing eye care services to the tribal community through conducting outreach screening camps in the unreached areas & providing door to door counselling. Clinical and management systems of the hospital are being strengthened by providing clinical inputs during clinical assessments 

 Quality service delivery and linkages with district health system will be established at the end of this project that will improve the CSR.

title: Rajnandgaon District ED CFH
description:
This project aims to ensure education of children with visual impairment and mainstreaming them in government schools. 

This project also intends to work in close collaboration with education departments and impart plus curriculum to facilitate their education. The parents / family members are trained to provide necessary support.

title: District IE Program
description:
District inclusive education program aims at working in close collaboration with Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan [SSA] to ensure that maximum numbers of visually impaired children are benefitted. This project is a district approach that focuses on district as a unit to better integrate with SSA.

In order to ensure education of visually impaired children, various interventions are taking place such as building capacities of government officials, parents, teachers and partner staff and direct inputs on imparting plus curriculum. 

It is envisaged that government system will create an environment of inclusive education to benefit approximately 316 children with visual impairment in the project area.

title: Jashpur Dist ED RAHA-Kansabel Bagicha
description:
The project aims at identification of children with visual impairment, facilitate provision of early intervention services and education. It also focuses to advocate with government for ensuring provision of appropriate educational, health and social benefits to these children. The parents, family members & community are sensitised and involved to create a supportive environment at home & in the community. 

This project works in close collaboration with different government departments and benefitting 65 children with visual impairment.

title: Satna Dist CES-CED Samaritans - new
description:
The project aim is to ensure quality education to children with visual impairment within mainstream education system. 
For this project work towards building a supportive environment for child education by sensitising and training school teachers, parents and peers. Secondly, through direct intervention, project supports children for quality education through training on plus curriculum, medical assessment of both blind and low vision children, providing aids and appliances, skill enhancement camps, promoting extra-curricular activities, etc. Thirdly, collaborating with concerned Government departments it ensures educational and other benefits for the child.
The project will see that Children with Visual Impairment will get education along with their sighted peers.

title: Vidisha Eye Care
description: Vidisha Eye Care

title: Dhimarkheda & Bohoribund CED - new
description: Previously on care and maintenance.

title: Bankhedi & Sonagpur NED Dalit
description: Previously on care and maintenance.

title: Satna Dist CES - EC
description: Comprehensive Eye Services

title: Satna Dist CES Sohwal CED
description:
The project aim is to ensure quality education to children with visual impairment within mainstream education system. 
Being a very poor area, the project helps children for quality education through training on plus curriculum, medical assessment of both blind and low vision children, providing aids and appliances, skill enhancement camps, training to teachers and relatives, exposure visits, promoting extra-curricular activities, etc. Support from Government was also generated for educational and other benefits.

The above intervention will ensure that CVIs will be able to utilise educational opportunities better and have better educational development.

title: Jabalpur Katni District
description:
The overall aim of the project is to ensure a better and equal opportunity environment for educational growth of children with visual impairment (CVIs) within mainstream education system. 
Various direct support are given like, training on plus curriculum, medical assessment of both blind and low vision children,  skill enhancement camps, sensitising teachers and relatives, exposure visits, promoting extra-curricular activities, etc. Some need based activities like training on adolescent health to VI girls, etc. was also incorporated. 
Advocacy with Government departments and village level bodies ensured monetary and other benefits like braille text books and assistive devices. The project also revived Parent Teacher Association for better monitoring and support for VI children. 
The CVIs thus will enjoy inclusive growth opportunity for their future development.

title: Jhabua District CES EC JJHS
description:
Aim of the project is to provide eye care services to the poor population of the project area
The activities to be implemented are hospital based intervention, providing eye care services through outreach screening camps, door to door counselling, awareness at community level as well as with medical personnel at grass root level and with health functionaries of other organisations on eye health issues, School screening programme by training school teachers on vision screening and developing linkages with Government system for better support for eye care services
There would be an overall uptake of eye care service by the people thus resulting in decrease in the overall incidence rate of blindness due to blinding eye conditions.

title: DSS IE Pipriya Block Hoshangabad
description: The project advocates with Government departments to ensure that all the children are in mainstream schools. They will ensure that they are getting all the provisioned benefits, receiving braille books and assistive devices. The project would also focus on computer enabled education, learning assessments of CVI children and building capacities of general school teachers.?

title: DSS CBR Pipriya Hoshangabad
description: The project work towards enhancing the accessibility and availability of appropriate eye care services, rehabilitation of VIs and education facilities to VI children which is in line with our CES strategy. The project also work for the empowerment of People with Disabilities (PWDs) in the form of forming & strengthening DPOs (Disable People Organisations) for their social inclusion. The proposed project work towards achieving broader goal of eliminating avoidable blindness along with empowerment of PWDs for better realisation of their rights & services through formation of DPOs and advocacy through right based approach. The self advocacy by the PWDs is envisaged as one of the main outcome of the programme. ? The ongoing programme of Social inclusion is working on the approach of strengthening DPO movement through right based approach. This project has been focusing on: Ensuring services to Person with Visual Impairments; Mobilising and empowering Persons with Diabilities thus  strengthening DPO; Livelihood empowerment; Building community engagement?

title: TASK IE SIHORA Block Jabalpur
description: The aim of this inclusive education project is to ensure equal participation of visually impaired children in mainstream education. This will be achieved by focusing activities on: Providing training on plus curriculum; Conducting skill enhancement camps; Providing computer enabled education to visually impaired children; Providing regular medical assessments for blind and visually impaired children; Teachers and relatives will receive capacity building; Providing sensitization of school management; Promotion of extra-curricular activities

title: TASK CBR SIHORA Block Jabalpur
description: The aim of this project is to ensure that people with visual impairments have equal rights and access to services. This social inclusion project operating in the Sihora Block of Jabalpur focuses on: Ensuring services to identified Person with Visual Impairments; Working with Panchayats for supporting primary eye care services in the area; Engaging community support through awareness and sensitisation; DPO strengthening; Livelihood empowerment; Training of community volunteers; Empowering and developing Person with Disabilities for advocating for their rights

title: Varanasi Dist. CES Harraua CBR
description:
Purpose of the project is that People with Visual impairment (PVIs) maximise their physical and mental abilities, to lead improved quality of life and be included in social, economic, and other development activities of the area; Community respects the needs and rights of PWDs and improve their access to opportunities and eye care services becomes accessible to the area, thus reducing the prevalence & incidence of vision impairment.
Key Activities of the project include assessment & training of the approximately 200 PVIs including vocational training; eye health support such as organising diagnostic camps & school screening and reaching to 3000 persons needing eye care; orienting PWDs towards their rights and collective functioning as DPO; and community orientations.
At the end of the project, People with visual impairment have requisite social and vocational skills and the community of the project area have better access to eye health services.

title: Sultan CES Kurebhar CBR YVDKSS
description: The project is working to improve social inclusion for people with disabilities in the Sultanpur district of the Uttar Pradesh region. The key activities for this project include: Capacity building of Persons with Visual Impairment (PVIs) on leadership, empowerment and advocacy; Promoting inclusion of Persons with Disabilities in government programmes through DPO; Capacity building and sensitization of government personnel; Organizing outreach diagnostic and school screening camps; Providing treatment for identified persons through screening camps; Providing rehabilitation services for Persons with Visual Impairments; To help Persons with Visual Impairments access work opportunities
Yuva Viklang Evam Drishtibadhitarth Kalyan Sewa Sansthan (YVDKSS)

title: Kanpur Rural Urban Dist CES
description:
The project goal is to reduce avoidable blindness in Kanpur (Urban) and Ramabai Nagar districts. The purpose of the project is to provide affordable and accessible comprehensive & quality eye care services in the underserved & inaccessible areas.

The key activities of the project are community awareness & screening camps, capacity building for Comprehensive eye care services, and support for developing the overall health systems.  

The end of the project is expected to create a better system of eye health in the project area and create community level systems creating better access to eye health and comprehensive eye care systems.

title: JVaranasi Pindra IE
description:
Project envisages strengthening the initiatives of Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan (SSA - Government of India flagship programme for Universalization of Elementary Education) in identifying and providing educational services to children with visual impairment from the project area.
Key project activities to support Inclusive Education includes support to visually impaired children, capacity building of education staff, community orientation and support of education material translating in inclusion of 16 children with vision impairment in mainstream education.

title: East UP Comprehensive Eye Care
description: This project will develop an approach of comprehensive eye care services. The key activities include: Outreach camps; Capacity building of key stakeholders including the government; System strengthening; Supporting specialised services such as Diabetic Retinopathy and Low Vision; Support services in areas of need; Establishing tele-medicine system; Generating awareness for changing the behaviour of the communities; Providing training for community volunteers, health workers, teachers and general health practitioners; Providing school screening programmes for assessment of low vision children
Indira Gandhi Eye Hospital & Research Centre (IGEHRC),

title: West Uttarakhand Comprehensive Eye Care Programme
description: This project focuses on providing comprehensive and quality eye-care services in the hilly tracts of Uttarakhand state. The projects main activities include: Establishing low vision and paediatric units; Organizing exclusive camps for diabetic retinopathy as well as comprehensive outreach diagnostic camps; Mobilisaition of community and civil society organizations for supporting eye care activities; To reduce the incidence of avoidable blindness by increasing the Cataract Surgical Rate; Facilitating social and economic rehabilitation of the blind /low vision people; Awareness building on Eye Health among the target population through community awareness camps per year

title: Samastipur District Eye Care Project- Ramakrishna
description: This project is now part of the Bihar Eye Health System Strengthening Project (63110)

title: Hazaribag District CES Ichak CBR - MANAV VIKAS
description: The project has come to an end in 30/04/12

title: Chauparan Block Pan CBR-Hazaribagh
description: This Cross Disability CBR project is focused on three primary types of disabilities; Visual Impairment, Hearing and Speech Disability and Persons with Locomotor Disability. The main activities of this project are:  Providing rehabilitation and additional support services to all identified persons with disability. This will be done in collaboration with the government; Facilitating the provision of appropriate educational, health and social benefits to identified disabled children; Capacitate the community to generate demand for availability and provision of affordable, accessible and quality of rehabilitative and education services in the project area. This will be implemented by community based organisations; To facilitate the process for formation of Disabled People's Organisation in the Chauparan block. These organisations will form direct links with similar organisations at the state and national level.

title: Dumka District CES Saraiahat CBR -CHETNA VIKAS
description: Dumka District CES Saraiahat CBR -CHETNA VIKAS

title: Jharkhand Inclusive Education Programme - Chetana
description: The aim of this project is to strengthen the Jharkhand Education system to include quality education for visually impaired children. The key activities of this Inclusive Education project include: Training and capacity building of Inclusive Education teachers and educational stakeholders; Creating awareness and sensitisation among people and communities about the education of disabled children in mainstream schools; Providing low vision services, teaching learning materials and assistive devices; Increasing access to local schools for visually impaired children; The project also focuses on building research and evidence base on inclusive education practice, advocacy with government and policy forums and developing effective communication materials; Conducting district level assessment camps for individuals identified as having low vision

title: North East Orissa CES Project - EC ACM
description: This project is merged into Orissa Eye Health System Strengthening Programme (63320)

title: NE Orissa CES Mayurbanj ED - ACM
description: The aim of this project is to provide quality education for visually impaired children in their local schools. The main activities of this inclusive education project include: Teacher training to provide quality education delivery for Visually Impaired students; Providing ICT based education; Working with District Education System to strengthen the school system; Advocating to ensure the provision of appropriate educational, health and social benefits for visually impaired students; Providing low vision assessment camps; Provision of learning materials and aids for visually impaired children; Conducting skill development camps for visually impaired children

title: Sonepur Boudh District CES - EC - LS
description: This project has now been merged with the Odisha Health System Strengthening project (63320)

title: Cuttack District CES - ED - RCCCT
description:
The Goal of the project is To ensure quality education of all visually impaired children in the project area. The project follows the following objectives to realise the goal:
 To build capacity of human resource of government, non-government agencies and parents for appropriate planning and implementation of the inclusive education programme.
 To advocate to government for ensuring provision of appropriate educational, health and social benefits to VI children.
 To ensure provision of early intervention services and education of visually impaired children as per their need. 
 To generate awareness among all stakeholders about inclusive education. 
 To advocate to government for support for the current model of the programme and adoption & replication of the best practices and in other places.  
The project activities including training and capacity building of IE human resources, developing local human resources in the field of Inclusive Education, creating awareness among people and communities on education of disabled persons, providing education support to the visually impaired children, teaching learning materials, low vision services, assistive aids & devices, organising stakeholder workshops and meetings, holding teacher-parents meetings, IEC activities etc.
Rotary Club of Cuttack Charitable Trust

title: Koraput District Education Project - SOVA
description: The aim of this project is to provide quality education to visually impaired students in their local schools. The main activities of this inclusive education project include: Teacher training to provide quality education delivery for Visually Impaired students; Providing ICT based education; Working with District Education System to strengthen the school system; Advocating to ensure the provision of appropriate educational, health and social benefits for visually impaired students; Providing low vision assessment camps; Provision of learning materials and aids for visually impaired children; Conducting skill development camps for visually impaired children

title: Kolkata Urban Comprehensive Eye Care Project
description: This project is designed to eliminate avoidable blindness in the Urban Slums of West Bengal. The main activities of this Comprehensive Eye Care Project include: Raising awareness about eye health; Increasing the access to affordable eye care services in Kolkata; Surgical interventions; Development and functioning of Vision Centres; Providing training to increase the human resource; Provision of visibility materials; Provision of spectacles; Advocating rights based issues of the Visually Impaired and Low Vision Individuals; Undertake research at various levels
Susrut Eye Foundation and Research Centre

title: Eastern India Comprehensive Child Eye health Initi
description:
The goal of the project is to Increase quality of life by eradicating avoidable blindness among low vision people in the eastern region of India. The objectives of the project are: 
 Active health workforce in place providing low vision services in three states of the eastern region during and after the project period 2013. 
 Network partners effectively functioning to provide low vision services in the eastern region of India during and after the project duration. 
 Effective supply management system is in place which provides supports to the network partners.
The project activities include training of ophthalmologist, optometrist in the field of  low vision, training & orientation to school teachers, local health workers, community level volunteers, setting up 6 low vision centres across three states, strengthening the low vision centre of VMA, eye surgeries of identified children, dispensing low vision devices to the low vision children, working with state education departments for integrating low vision services in school health programmes, developing training modules/ IEC materials on low vision, developing model low vision resource centre, simulation park for visually impaired children, undertaking research in the field of low vision and developing a network of low vision partners in Eastern India.

title: Comprehensive Eye care services in Nadia District,
description: This project has ended in December 2012

title: West Bengal Inclusive Education project  Majhihir
description: The aim of this project is to provide quality education for visually impaired children in West Bengal. The main project activities include: Training and capacity building of Inclusive Education human resources; Developing local human resources in the field of Inclusive Education; Raising awareness among people and communities on education of disabled persons; Organising skill development camps for disabled children; Providing education support to the visually impaired children through the provision of teaching and learning materials, low vision services, assistive aids and devices; Organising stakeholder workshops and meetings; Holding teacher-parents meetings

title: Sunderban EH Strengthening Programme
description:
The goal of the project is to contribute to eradication of avoidable blindness in the Sunderban Region of West Bengal comprising of 19 districts from North 24 Parganas & South 24 Parganas Districts. 
Objectives:
1. To improve accessibility of eye health services in Sunderban area of West Bengal by 2016.
2. To enhance institutional capacity of health infrastructure at the district level of South 24 Parganas & North 24 Parganas.
Key Activities include provision of primary eye care services, provision of secondary eye care services, Capacity building of human resources in the government systems & NGO Hospitals, Support NGO Hospitals for secondary eye health service delivery and support for development of government systems for eye health service delivery

title: Jaipur Urban Eye Care Programme
description: Urban health in India is one of the neglected components within the broader health system. Eye health therefore receives less attention as compared to broader urban health issues. Refractive error is one of the most ignored and one of the major contributors to blinding conditions among the urban poor. This initiative intends to improve access to eye health services in slums of Jaipur in 3 years time, through outreach services through static and mobile centres and referring patients needing surgical or treatment interventions to Government / NGO hospitals within the city.

title: Vision Delhi PEC
description: The aim of this project is to provide accessible and affordable eye care services for people living in the Delhi Slums. The main activities of this project are:  Establishing five vision centres across slums of East, South and West Delhi to ensure comprehensive services of Cataract, Glaucoma, Diabetic Retinopathy, Refractive Error and Low vision; Establishing a mechanism for joint planning, implementing and resource pooling for addressing Refractive Error among school children; Providing training for school teachers to undertake refractive error screening; Providing training for community level volunteers to aid in the mobilisation of people with refractive errors to access community eye care services; Providing free spectacles for children both in school and out of school

title: Opthalmic Mission Trust - Dahod District Eye Hospi
description: The purpose of the project is to support the training cell of Drishti Netralaya by strengthening the vitreoretinal and diabetic retinopathy speciality clinic. This will allow for 50 Ophthalmologists to be trained on medical/surgical retinal disease management. The retina department of the Ophthalmic Mission Trust  Dahod will develop into a training centre and provide Ophthalmic Surgeons to Sightsavers partner hospitals and also Ophthalmic Surgeons to district hospitals.
Drashti Netralaya run by Ophthalmic Mission Trust

title: Dristi Bhuj Refractive Error Project
description: This project focused on providing refractive error services In Kutch district of Gujarat through vision centres including provision of spectacles and low vision aids. 13044 persons, including children received spectacles

title: NAB Haryana - IE project
description:
This project is being implemented in a very challenging area  Mewat, in which there is visible disparity in distribution of wealth. Mewat is one of the districts having lowest female literacy rate and it has nearly 78% Muslim population which is one of the highest in the country; the average family size is 7.5 and is the highest in the State.   

This project supports 198 low vision and blind children for education and all-round development through addressing the issues of lack of human resources, creating awareness among community, and promoting inclusive education in a situation where current service providers are lacking.
National Association for the Blind, Faridabad Branch

title: Bikaner District EC URMUL Jyoti
description: This project focused on addressing primary and secondary level eye health issues in Bikaner, Churu and Nagaur districts of Rajasthan through the base hospital located in Nokha block of Bikaner. Majority of the hospitals patients are walk-in, in addition to those referred from the seven vision centres spread across Bikaner (which are part of the social inclusion programme in the district). It conducts about 4000 cataract surgeries annually of which about 50% are supported by Sightsavers. The hospital has laid plans for sustainability by adopting a cross subsidization approach and hence is attracting paying patients from nearby districts and States.

title: Nagaur Block CES - UKS
description: Comprehensive Eye Services

title: Bikaner Dist CES Urmul Trust
description:
These five projects (64511, 64512, 64513, 64514 and 64515) were part of the Bikaner district level initiative and adopted a similar approach. These are Community Based Rehabilitation (CBR) Projects implemented on Comprehensive Eye Services (CES) approach as part of the district level initiative. The projects aimed to identify and rehabilitate visually impaired people, empower disabled people through the formation of a DPO (Disabled Peoples Organisation) at the block level and federating it to the District level. The projects also referred cases identified with cataract to base hospital run by Urmul Jyoti in the district and the district hospital thereby reducing the prevalence of cataract blindness. 

Over 500 people with visual impairment were supported with rehabilitation initiatives including income generation/enhancement initiatives, which enhanced their overall quality of life. 168 children with visual impairment of school going age were identified and enrolled in mainstream schools; and are continuing to receive quality education. The project also mobilized benefits about INR 23 million from various government schemes for disabled people. The advocacy initiatives also resulted in 13 times increase in allocation in livelihood schemes for disabled people in the district.
